column1: Asset value not saving or mapping correctly after updates
column32:
There is an issue in the assets section where updated values are not saving correctly after the first save and refresh. The following steps outline the problem:

# *Steps to Reproduce:*
#* Save an initial value for an asset (e.g., 1000).
#* Edit the value (e.g., from 1000 to 4000).
#* Refresh the page.
#* The system will display the value as 400 instead of 4000.
#* When the value is edited again, it saves properly.
# *Additional Issue in 3 to 1 Loan Document:*
#* After updating the asset value (e.g., from 1000 to 4000), the system incorrectly maps the value to 5000 in the loan document.
#* The mapping works fine initially but breaks after the value is updated.

*Expected Behavior:*

* The updated asset value should save and display correctly after the first edit and refresh.
* The 3 to 1 loan document should map the correct asset value after an update (e.g., 4000 instead of 5000).

*Actual Behavior:*

* The value does not save properly after the first update and refresh (e.g., 400 is shown instead of 4000).
* The loan document incorrectly maps the asset value after an update (e.g., 5000 instead of 4000).


*See the screen recording below for better understanding.*

!Screen Recording 2024-09-23 at 3.20.03 PM.mov|width=1428,height=910,alt="Screen Recording 2024-09-23 at 3.20.03 PM.mov"!

column1: Investment Loan - Security Value  - Add Warning Message
column26: Package 3 - July - UPLOC, Bridge, Corp Inv Loan; Welcome Packages
column32: For investment loans, there is confusion around what to put in the security value field.   So please add a warning message upon save of the Collateral Security Section and check that the LTV is 75%.   That is for a $600,000 loan, the total security value is $800,000.   That is 600,000 / $800,000 = 75%.     Or 600,000 / 0.75 = 800,000

column1: Compress PDFs Imported via Import Scan
column32: We need to implement PDF compression for all PDFs imported through the import scan feature. The goal is to reduce the file size of large PDFs to optimize storage and improve upload times

column1: Urgent BDK
Implement Circuit for Loan Rejection Process
column32: Currently, the Business Banking System uses a circuit for various operations, such as loan transmission and approval. However, there is no circuit in place for the loan rejection process. This task is to design and implement a circuit for handling loan rejections, ensuring that the process is properly controlled and audited, similar to other loan-related operations.

column246:
29/Aug/24 8:35 AM;62b55f5ad337d0b7d09eb9e2;Checked today and found following issues using Client 1628

# Business email not mapped

!image-20240827-195255.png|width=979,height=943,alt="image-20240827-195255.png"!

# Organization Identification and other fields should be mapped

!image-20240827-195853.png|width=647,height=461,alt="image-20240827-195853.png"!



Fields populated in production include: Let’s discuss each

* AB01 and AB02 etc depending on number of owners (Address)
* BIDC - 9 digit tax number (same as BIN#)
* CIFO - Who ever transmits to DNA (Admin team member)
* CORD - INcorporation Date
* CORP - Corporation #
* DBA = Operating Name
* FB01, FB02, FB03, FB04 = First name(s) of Owner
* KYC = Date KYC updated - date account open
* LB01, LB02, LB03, LB04 - last name(s) of owner
* NOFB - Nature of Business
* PB01, PB02, PB03 PB04 - Percentages of each owner -
* PINC = Place of Registration
* PINT = default “Business Loan for Investing”
* PNFE = Yes if ‘The Entity is a passive non-financial entity’ selected in drop down in Business Banker Client profile
* STDL = default to ‘Electronic Banking’



# Tax - FATCA Reportable and CRS Reportable - Ask Atif if this can be populated

!image-20240827-205005.png|width=435,height=311,alt="image-20240827-205005.png"!

# Ownership Percentage not populated

!image-20240827-205322.png|width=476,height=341,alt="image-20240827-205322.png"!



# Need to open Business Start Me Up Savings instead of Daylight No Fee Savings

!image-20240827-205608.png|width=420,height=222,alt="image-20240827-205608.png"!



The Owners should be linked to Corporation in the roles as signers…. “Authorized MDSB signer' and ‘Non-tax signer’ - Is this the current limitation? I think we can do for the loan (which I have not yet tested).

column1: HTML Formatting Displayed Instead of Formatted Text in Additional Comment Section
column32: When users add comments in the "Additional Comments" section of the form and apply formatting (such as bold, italic, etc.), the formatted text appears correctly in the form. However, when the document is mapped, the text is displayed with HTML tags instead of the applied formatting. This leads to an incorrect representation of the intended formatting in the final output.

column1: Unable to Add Clients or Create Savings Accounts in DNA (Staging)
column32:
Currently, users are unable to add clients to DNA or create savings accounts. The savings account creation process requires that Client 1 and Client 2 be added to DNA, but this functionality is blocked.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Attempt to add a new client in the DNA system.
# Observe the inability to proceed with client addition.
# Attempt to create a savings account.
# Note that savings account creation is blocked until clients are added.

*Expected Result:*

* Users should be able to add clients to DNA without encountering errors.
* Users should be able to create savings accounts once Client 1 and Client 2 are added.


See the attached Screen Shot

column1: Scenario where existing member and user is forced to add a second savings account in BB
column32:
Today, system allows user to select client from DNA via Search, however, will always create a Savings Account.



For existing users, we do not want to create a new savings account.



There should be a search for existing savings account against the existing client.   If there is, it should bring it up and allow user to select.   If there isn’t, then the user should be able to create new savings account for loan disbursement.

26/Sep/24 5:33 PM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;[~accountid:62b55f5ad337d0b7d09eb9e2] [~accountid:712020:a5cdc34c-2a6a-4e4b-91aa-53da0c7d2a46] 

I think adding a new client either advisor adding or import works pretty well. 

Not sure though why this is causing an issue.  It gave a message for Carlos Joy as follows and then not able to select Savings account



!image-20240926-221106.png|width=835,height=496,alt="image-20240926-221106.png"!



!image-20240926-220941.png|width=1185,height=565,alt="image-20240926-220941.png"!



However, I have tested two scenarios as follows:

# Take {color:#ff991f}existing {color}client that already has loan opened (only one borrower).  Now they want to borrow again, but now with co-borrower.  So select ‘New loan’.   In this case, when user adds member, the search should find the first borrower.   User selects.  The search should not find the second borrower.  The user adds.   and when searching the savings account, I expect to find the Savings account, but in this case, the user will not select as the savings account is only in first borrower’s name.  However, I get this when I select.  It appears it is remembering the savings account from first loan.



!image-20240926-212141.png|width=807,height=231,alt="image-20240926-212141.png"!



#  Take existing joint that already has loan opened (2 borrower).  Now the first borrower wants to borrow again by themselves.   In this case, the search the first borrower and also should find the savings account.  The user will select the member, but will create a new savings account only under their name.    





It should allow user to select the savings account or create new one 



We can discuss on call

01/Oct/24 5:41 PM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;[~accountid:62b55f5ad337d0b7d09eb9e2] [~accountid:712020:a5cdc34c-2a6a-4e4b-91aa-53da0c7d2a46] screen captures looks good.

{color:#ff991f}Only question is why is account open date always blank?   Same when I tested.  Otherwise, all looks good.  Let’s discuss on daily{color}



I also tested scenario where i am a lender and imported existing IFA for existing commercial client  with 2 owners (one different), that it came up with the savings account for commercial client, and I chose to create new one.



I then tested as an advisor, chose existing client who had co-borrower on previous loan and then now with solo borrower.   The existing borrower pre-populated the DNA number (no chance for user to select which is fine).  And then when it came time to search, it found the previous savings account

Create new coborrower to DNA

column252: 02/Oct/24 10:17 AM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;TO add more context, when we first add Savings Account, it is in Approved status - so the contract open date is blank.  When Funder funds the loan, the balance goes to Savings account which activates the Savings Account.  So we should be good as the missing Open date / Contract Date will never be blank in production.

column1: Docusign - Status and Feedback
column32:
When advisor sends to client for docusign, there is no feedback whether the email went through, and who they are waiting for. Docusign has that information so this is to relay the information back to the advisor.

Currently, it only shows:

# When Sent
# Once Completed



!image-20240627-154519.png|width=538,height=126,alt="image-20240627-154519.png"!



In future want:

# When it is sent initially (No change from today)
# Who it is waiting for to sign (New) - put in same line as Sent
# Since when we have been waiting for them to sign (New)
# Indicate if there is an error e.g. Bounceback (I see this in Docusign, so would be good for this to appear).  Put this right under Waiting for to sign…
# Once Completed, update as today, replacing ‘Who it is waiting for’

See below image for design idea.



!image-20240627-162311.png|width=1546,height=219,alt="image-20240627-162311.png"!



Tests

# Single Borrower test and check 
## status once sent - should show waiting for borrower (same date and time as ‘Sent’)
## status once borrower signs - should now be showing waiting for advisor (date and time waiting for advisor - different date and time then ‘Sent’)
## status of Complete once all signed (and replaces the text of ‘waiting for’)
# Two borrower test and check

          a. status once sent - should show waiting for borrower (same date and time as ‘Sent’

          b. status once borrower signs - should now be showing waiting for borrower 2 (date and time waiting for borrower 2 - different date and time then ‘Sent’)

         c.  status once borrower 2 signs - should now be showing waiting for advisor (date and time waiting for advisor - different date and time then ‘Sent’ and borrower 1)

         d.  status of Complete once all signed (and replaces the text of ‘waiting for’)

# Two borrower Email address error test and check

          a. status once sent (with error  in borrower 1 email address ) - should show waiting for borrower (same date and time as ‘Sent’.  If error in email address, error message in red font below the Status indicating email bounceback (Take verbiage from Docusign)

          b. status once borrower has successfully signed after correcting email address, (with error in borrower 2 email address) .   Should show waiting for borrower 2, but with message in red font below the status indicating email bounceback (Take verbiage from Docusign)

         c.  status once borrower 2 signs after correcting email address - should now be showing waiting for advisor but advisor has error in email address - should show waiting for advisor, but with message in red font below the status indicating email bounceback (Take verbiage from Docusign)

column1: Operational tasks should not be tied to ADMIN or SUPER ADMIN Rights
column32:
For example, Import Scan is only available for users with SuperADMIN rights.  whereas Import Credit Bureau to Adjusted Liabilities is only available to users with ADMIN rights.

These functionalities should be tied to the role of the user in this case SL.

column1: Logic incorrect for Margin Account
column26: Package 4 - October - Margin, QC Checks, Docusign
column32:
Should not be a breach.

Rule is as follows:

# If 3:1, should show up as Breached if over 100%+
# In subsequent week
## If it shows up as 99.01%+, it remains a breach
## If it shows up as under 99%, it is no longer a breach
### Then it resets such that once it is over 100%, then it is breached again

June 19 - shows as no longer breach

!image-20240626-200251.png|width=1037,height=764,alt="image-20240626-200251.png"!

June 26 - shows as breach even though it was under 99% the week before.  It should not be breached, but should be courtesy.



!image-20240626-200741.png|width=1025,height=440,alt="image-20240626-200741.png"!

column1: Equifax Import to Adjusted Liabilities are duplicated
column32:
Few issues

# After pulling equifax for borrower and co-borrower, and lender is trying to import to adjusted liabilities, the trade lines are duplicated and does not show the coborrowers trade lines.   
# Should have indicator which is imported already
# Should be able to indicate which trade is same for each borrower, so user only imports once.   And if already imported, then it should indicate that for coborrower too.    In Doxim/LOS the system is smart enough to only import unique records.

For example, if Mortgage ABC is shown for both borrower and co-borrower, currently shows for both clients.   It should only show once for importing.

column1: Transfer API Call - some fields Incorrect
column32:
3 fixes needed:

# Cashbox should be 262 and not 403 (unassigned) for Transfer Call
# The $1 transaction amount should be the full loan amount
# The transaction type of New Loan Disbursement (NDSB) should be changed to Principal Disbursement (PBSB) to align with what we do today manually
column245: 25/Jun/24 12:33 PM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;[~accountid:62b55f5ad337d0b7d09eb9e2] [~accountid:626ebda502e1c10069bb9ced] Will leave for now and postpone further changes until we discuss with Curry in accounting and test after July 5.  Right now, we have excluded the transfer call API
column246:
05/Jul/24 7:43 AM;62b55f5ad337d0b7d09eb9e2;[~accountid:62741546106b60006f5964c5]  [~accountid:626ebda502e1c10069bb9ced] 
Point 1 :  is clear you want to change cashbox from *403* to *262*
Point 2 : right now we are sending FundAmount -1 into {{Transfer - From}} body, and 1 into {{Transfer - To}} body.
[~accountid:626ebda502e1c10069bb9ced]  should i pass 1 in Transfer From body also ?
atif: it’s full loan amount
Point 3 : is also clear you want to change transaction type from *NDSB* to *PDSB*
column247: 10/Jul/24 10:33 AM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;[~accountid:62b55f5ad337d0b7d09eb9e2] [~accountid:626ebda502e1c10069bb9ced] [~accountid:712020:261c0e4a-8bb5-4085-8acf-bde7f3f8ada3] We can start testing this one, but will need our Account team to be part of testing, so likely won’t be in for this release. Code is deployed on stagging you can test.

The loan side is ok, but the funding side (deposit fund into member saving accounts) is wrong. It seems transaction code NA is used to deposit fund into member accounts. I believe NA is for opening new membership share, shouldn’t we use DEP (deposit) instead?

column1: Release in production June 24, 2024
column32:
h2. Description

*Next Deployment in production :*

Business Banker- Release Note : 3.2.746.19

Prepared for DUCA on June 21, 1 pm 2024 (EST)

Release Date: Wednesday, June 24 ,2024 between 2-7 am (EST)

 

*MINOR RELEASE*

 

*Bug Fixes* 

 [https://cognitivegroup.atlassian.net/browse/BBDS-781|https://cognitivegroup.atlassian.net/browse/BBDS-781|smart-link]

[https://cognitivegroup.atlassian.net/browse/BBDS-786|https://cognitivegroup.atlassian.net/browse/BBDS-786|smart-link]

[https://cognitivegroup.atlassian.net/browse/BBDS-800|https://cognitivegroup.atlassian.net/browse/BBDS-800|smart-link]

[https://cognitivegroup.atlassian.net/browse/BBDS-712|https://cognitivegroup.atlassian.net/browse/BBDS-712|smart-link]

[https://cognitivegroup.atlassian.net/browse/BBDS-761|https://cognitivegroup.atlassian.net/browse/BBDS-761|smart-link]



----

*QUESTIONS TO BE ANSWERED*

* Minor or Major Release? Minor
* Specify Who approves, who deploys? Francois Aubin needs to give final approval before Zain deploys
* Changes visible to users; Yes or No (functionality change, speed) ? Yes
* Indicate Revert method for code, and for configuration ? Usual methods
* Indicate Test method in production: Meeting organized Richard Yong 24, June 2024
*RELEASE NOTE*

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/19ZspHq3P-hBCRShw8qk9b2xGLWWtASw2SrpumPmu9vY/edit?usp=sharing|https://docs.google.com/document/d/19ZspHq3P-hBCRShw8qk9b2xGLWWtASw2SrpumPmu9vY/edit?usp=sharing|smart-link]

column1: Collateral Security - Booking Slip - for all the dealers that have 'MPC', should be Mandeville Private Client Inc.
column32:
Right now, we have multiple groups that have MPC in their name which maps to Mandeville Private Client Inc.  



For example Shawket - MPC.    This is appearing in the dealer field, however, when it gets to the Booking Slip, it needs to say “Mandeville Private Client Inc.” and not ‘Shawket MPC’

column1: Duplication issue in the decision section in some cases.
Anomalie sur les dossiers refusés
column32:
Bonjour,  

  

J’ai remarqué que ce dossier a été refusé par le DE mais le statut est ‘Approuvé ‘ et transmis au DG . 

  

Sauf erreur , c’est le même point d’arbitrage qui a été remonté par GUINDO . 

  

En cas de refus du DE , c’est le DGAFEM qui doit faire l’arbitrage et le statut ne devrait pas être ‘ Approuvé’ . 

  

Merci de voir svp

Business Banker- Release Note : 3.2.746.18

Prepared for DUCA on June 11, 1 pm 2024 (EST)

* Specify Who approves, who deploys? Francois Aubin needs to give final approval before Zain deploys

* Indicate Revert method for code, and for configuration ? Usual methods
* Indicate Test method in production: Meeting organized Richard Yong 12, June 2024

column1: Need to add and map more fields to DNA

# The Authorizer should be mapped to DNA - this is the Credit Risk person who signed in and changed status to ‘Finalizing’ after transmitting to funder
# BCN1 should be mapped with Beacon Tax Owner’s credit score
# BCN2 should be mapped with Beacon Non Tax Owner’s credit score
# Assigned to Field shows incorrectly as 'COGNITIVE ESBUSER'.  In this case, should be Janice Morton

column1: Rapports Business Banker
column32:
Bonjour François  

  

Comme échangé, nous souhaitons revoir le format des rapports qui sont disponibles sur Business BANKER. 

  

Ci-dessous les extractions demandées, qui devront être disponibles en téléchargement. 
* Extraction des performances de la DBE (toute la direction)
* Extraction des performances de la DBD (toute la direction)
* Extraction des performances du DGAPED 
* Extraction des performances de la DE (toute la direction)
* Extraction des performances du DGAFEM
* Extraction des performances du DG
* Extraction des performances de la cellule de rédaction
* Extraction des performances du CA
 

  

 *Dans un premier temps , merci de nous fournir ces extractions sur la période du 01-01-2023 au 31-05-2024.* 

  

Cordialement  

  

  

!image001.png|thumbnail!

Bien reçu.  

J’espère que tu vas bien, je veux qu’on reprenne le sujet sur la montée de version de BB afin de le présenter à la nouvelle direction générale pour une mise en œuvre au semestre prochain. 

Mais avant cela nous allons recueillir tous les besoins en interne auprès des métiers à te soumettre avant d’organiser la démo. 

Je reste disponible pour tout échange. 

Cordialement

column1: Margin Report Production Issue - Ancillary Collateral
column32:
{quote}Start time:
 EST 9:18 am (within business hours)
Resolution time: 

EST 1:42 pm (within business hours) for

* Margin Report Ancillary Collateral Issue

FROM RICHARD: Just to add more details, Andrea ran validate and noticed that there were loans missing and concluded that they were the ancillary collateral which prompted her to look at the ancillary collateral report which showed the odd characters etc. below….

FROM ZAIN : We have identified and resolved the issue. However to send it to production we need to send a hotfix.

This fix only requires us to send the frontend which won't cause a disruption, let me know if you approve it.

{quote}

column1: Import Scan of amounts in assets and liabilities with 'M' and 'K' for million and 1000
column32: Sometimes advisors represent $1,000 with a K (for example, $10,000 = $10K) and $1,000,000 with a M (for example, $20,000,000 = $20M).    It would be great if import scan can pick that up.

column1: Auto email for Equitable Investment Loans
column32:
Generate email and send to [Specializedlendingadmin@duca.com|mailto:Specializedlendingadmin@duca.com] once the Equitable Investment Loan is in Opened/Funded Status.

----



Hi Equitable Life Team,

 

DUCA has completed an investment loan and released the following wire transfer to your Royal Bank Account for the following client:

 

Name: {color:#ff991f}Kevin D’Souza{color}

Equitable Life Policy Number: {color:#ff991f}601227416{color}

DUCA Unique Loan ID: {color:#ff991f}551962930294 {color}_(Again not DNA number, but DNA number +22704)_

Amount of Wire Transfer{color:#ff991f} $60,000.00 {color}

Date of Wire Transfer: {color:#ff991f}May 28, 2024 {color}_(today’s date)_

 

We have attached the signed Acknowledgement Form to assign the policy to DUCA and the wire transfer details.

 Thanks,

column1: Add GIC or Deposit for IFA and MSLOC
column32:
For IFA and MSLOC, both personal and corporate, need to add in collateral security ‘GIC / Term Deposits’.    (Note for MSLOC, already have GIC or Deposits - need to replace to GIC / Term Deposits)    Then need to clean up the fields as below; and also map to the attached security document. [^9 - Agreement for Security on Shares and Deposit.pdf] 



Test Success Criteria

#  Business Banker should have drop down in Collateral Security with fields and defaults as follows for both IFA and MSLOC, Personal and Corporate (No need for insurer, owner etc):

|Reference|Label|{color:#ff991f}Value{color}|Comments|
|A|Security*|{color:#ff991f}GICs / Term Deposits{color}| |
|B|Number|{color:#ff991f}1{color}|System default (greyed out and disabled)|
|C|Dealer*|{color:#ff991f}DUCA{color}|Only DUCA in drop down as only DUCA allowed (greyed out and disabled)|
|D|Security Account Number:| |This also shows on the inline field|
|E|Registered in the Name(s) of:| |Default to Borrowers names and allow user to update|
|F|Due Date| |Date field that user selects|



Note that most of the fields are optional.   

#  If there is security of GICs / Term Deposits, then map to attach document and present in Documents tab.   See reference and comments below:



!image-20240708-175123.png|width=700,height=775,alt="image-20240708-175123.png"!





!image-20240708-175410.png|width=712,height=483,alt="image-20240708-175410.png"!



Section should be renamed to Security Documents - GICs/ Term Deposits.



The document should be named:  Agreement for Security on Shares and Deposits

!image-20240708-175847.png|width=1011,height=546,alt="image-20240708-175847.png"!

column1: Map MSLOC Personal with Corporate Applications
column26: Package 3 - July - UPLOC, Bridge, Corp Inv Loan; Welcome Packages
column32:
After Import Scan of MSLOC Personal with Corporate Security Application Business Banker needs to map and create MSLOC Personal with Corporate Security Application so ADMIN can send it out.

So the test success criteria is

# Import Scan MSLOC Corporate Application  - All information is populated on BB - the application is automatically attached
# Then user makes update on Business Banker (client fields, loan fields)
# User then downloads updated MSLOC Corporate Application with the updated fields (fields should be refreshed with new data when go to Documents Tab)

We did this for MSLOC personal - need to do same for other 2 MSLOC applications.

column1: SPL Data automatically gets updated
column26: Package 3 - July - UPLOC, Bridge, Corp Inv Loan; Welcome Packages
column32:
Today, SPL data is manually created and updated by the Specialized Lending Admin team.  

Since we now have all the information with linking to DNA, we should be able to automate updating this page for margining purposes.

* Loan Number = number pulled from DNA once funder clicks Add Loan to DNA
* Unique ID = the Loan Number + 22704
* Is (P+I) Payment? = leave blank always (even if P&I repayment as it is used for different purpose)
* Co-Borrower for SPL data = CoBorrower’s name
* Loan Subclassification = ‘10’ for investment loans; ‘12’ for MSLOCs
* Open Date = Funding Date
* Close Date = leave blank
* Status = ‘Active’
* Product = “3:1” for Investment Loans or for MSLOC, leave Blank - user will need to update on those rare occasions
* Amount = Principal Disbursement Amount
* LOC Security = ‘MFs/ETFs’ as always investments or seg funds
* Partner Name = Dealer Name of Advisor who submitted deal
* Partner Code = ???
* Partner Account Number = Security Account Number from Collateral Security
* Advisor Name = Advisor Name from Advisor Tab
* Advisor Code = Advisor Code from Advisor Tab
* Initial Lender and ID = Loan Officer on Booking Slip and corresponding ID
* Current Lender and ID = Loan Officer on Booking Slip and corresponding ID

column1: Booking Slip - Primary Borrower's Credit Score Auto update
column32:

Also, there should be no decimal places.

Test Success Criteria:

# Pull Personal Equifax bureau record with score.   Score is auto-populated to Primary Borrower’s Credit Score
# There are no decimal places in Credit Score 
# Allow 3 digits

column1: Search Member not working
column32:
Search is again not working in Staging and UAT (and Production). 



The criteria should be:



If match SIN, retrieve record;

If no SIN Match, then match based on FN, LN and DOB and retrieve record(s)

If no Match for FN, LN, DOB, then match based on FN, LN and retrieve record(s)

If no FN, LN, then create allow user to create new member to DNA.

column1: Map new Letter of Direction - Loan Proceeds
column32:
Need to map to new Letter of Direction - Loan Proceeds - see attached



Test success criteria

# Keep in Word format and don’t change to PDF
# Add borrower(s) names - could be personal or corporate (#1 below)
# Add the disbursement amount from booking slip (#2)

column1: Investment Loan - Insurance as collateral
column32:
For Investment Loans with insurance serving as collateral (making up the 25% equity portion), the advisor should not see the Security Documents - Insurance.    This is because the insurer needs to sign as well and the advisor would not be sending to the insurance company - Admin will.



So can we make it similar to Admin documents section where Advisor does not see these sections?



Advisor logged in:  In this case should see loan application and Security Documents - Segregated Funds as the collateral is SEG FUNDS and INSURANCE

!image-20240426-142410.png|width=909,height=391,alt="image-20240426-142410.png"!

Here is when ADMIN role logs in.  Notice that it has Administrative Documents section - Security Documents - Insurance should have same logic (i.e. not visible to Advisor)

column1: AD1 Advisor cannot see coborrower if AD2 created
column32:
Steps to reproduce

# Sign in as AD2
# Create borrower 1
# Create borrower 2
# Update the advisor to AD1 (Edit and select AD1 in client tab)

When sign in as AD1, only see the first borrower and not the second.    I believe both borrowers should be available for AD1.  Also, AD1 cannot transmit and I think they should.

Test success criteria:

# AD2 should be able to work on all AD1 Files even if transmit back to AD1 from lender
# AD1 should be able to work on their own file, even if transmit back to AD2 from lender
# AD1 should be able to see all clients and transmit even if transmit back to AD2 from lender

KEEP IN MIND:

That AD2 only should see their own branch and not all branches.  AD1 should only see their own deals when they are the advisor of record.

column1: Can edit "due date" in corporate but not in retail
Margin Breach - Bug
column26: Package 4 - October - Margin, QC Checks, Docusign
column32:
This account has LTV of 99.8%, but it shows as Breach. 



The rule is that once breached (100% LTV for 3:1 loan), then it needs to get back under 99% for it not to breach.

This account was on P&I and we removed them off P&I because LTV was under 99%. Then it is now above 99%, but not 100%, so should not be breach.

column1: New field and value to map into DNA
column32:
Previously, we added:

GEX1, GEX2, GEX3 and Personal Net Worth fields on Booking slip of Business Banker.   The Personal Net Worth is already a value in drop down of GEX1, GEX2, GEX3.  However DNA did not have these fields.  

DNA now has these fields.



Test Success Criteria:

Now we need to map to DNA:

# The value Personal Net Worth when selected in GEX1  … Need to map Personal Net Worth (17)
# The value Personal Net Worth when selected in GEX2   … Need to map Personal Net Worth (17)
# The value Personal Net Worth when selected in GEX3{color:#36b37e}   {color}… Need to map Personal Net Worth (17)
# Personal Net Worth (PNW) field.   This is user field ‘PNW’

Looks good when 

# All documents completed and transmit to SL from AD1 - correct message saying ‘AD1 submitted application ready for review…’
# After sending (without Docusign completion and attach of app) and transmitting - it has the ‘Advisor preparing app message…’ 
# Before sending (without Docusign completion and attach of app) and transmitting - it has the ‘Advisor preparing app message’

{color:#ff5630}But not good in this case when the Advisor already transmitted without completion of Docusign, and application is now attached:{color}

# After Docusign completed and reattached automatically - a message is sent to SL ‘Now application is attached and ready for your review.   The body of email is good except the subject line.    Currently, it has in the subject line the SL name.  “{color:#ff5630}[Lender] submitted a new 3 to 1 investment loan application for client [Client name] for your review{color}”.   This means they sent to themselves as email is going to SL email.       To keep it simple let’s not put the name of role in subject line and just say:    {color:#36b37e}A new 3:1 investment loan application for client [CLIENT NAME] has now been attached.   {color}



Let me know if you have questions

column1: Implement test before and after Production for Release work (such as Create VPN tunnel for Celero).
column32:
[~accountid:712020:261c0e4a-8bb5-4085-8acf-bde7f3f8ada3] [~accountid:5fe1ffaba9d030010747a650] As part of SOC2, we need to give reasonable insurance that all changes that are deployed to production have been tested before they go to production.  For that we use tickets to provide evidences.  

*Ex: For code change & configuration change*  we are covered because:  before we deploy to production on Fridays, Hiba has already said “OK in mirrror” or “looks good in mirror” right after she performed her tests in mirror.  Sometimes this evidence if provided by Richard the day before the release, which is good too, because of the special relationship we have with Richard. 

*For any infra change,*  we don’t have that evidence, and it might vary depending on the work.  I suggest the following: Developer should write in Jira (when in mirror) one of these that apply : 

* to be tested by Hiba in mirror , or 
* “I performed test a, test b, test c and it looks good in mirror”  @ ask another dev to check.  Ex:  Checked that DNA is working fine. 
* Cannot test in mirror, test is planned with Richard Yong right after the release (like it should have been the case for Create VPN tunnel for Celero)   

*We miss for all:* any visible impact on users.   Need to say that for evidence: not visibile impact on user…..

*For any infra change,* we also miss *the revert method (because our new infra does not allow it), so we don’t talk about it and it is not applicable.*
column245: 18/Apr/24 8:42 AM;5fe1ffaba9d030010747a650;[~accountid:712020:261c0e4a-8bb5-4085-8acf-bde7f3f8ada3] Can you add a desc, I don’t understand the task.
column246:
16/May/24 7:03 AM;70121:a2dd7e75-6319-4926-91a5-74785bb6ee3d;When we do special changes (ex: non routine changes such as infrastructure change, move from .net 3.1 to .net 8, etc.), 

* Developers need to think ahead to determine if there are *specials tests to do*.  And then, provide evidence (in Jira tickets) that we have done them.   
* Developers need to think about the *reverts method* in case there is a problem (and write it in Jira)
* Need to ask ourselves, if there a visible impact on users: Yes or no.  And put it in Jira. 

Based on that , we then decide if we publish those in the release note to clients.

Release work on VPN tunnel for Celero. Outage outside of business hours was expected. {quote}


We were configuring the new VPN tunnels for Celero on our Servers and that required a Network change. However a bad configuration of the database caused the problem.  Tests in production were not possible. Our monitors detected it, but by mistake the team thought that it was solved after 13 minutes outside of business hours.

column1: Security tasks
column32:
# The “deactivation” of a user account (change of profile to deactivated) upon resignation does not prevent them from connecting with their login/password. And it has already happened that ex-collaborators have accessed and manipulated the data.
# There is no password strength check (even 1234 is accepted as a password)

# There are no expiration times for the password which remains the same ad-vitam

column1: Have warning message indicating that certain fields not populated, but can continue
column32:
Today, if certain fields that are mandatory are not populated, then the user cannot transmit to the next step.

Because in some cases, it is okay to continue, we should change the options and messages



Here are the messages today in various situations for reference only

# This is advisor role when they try to transmit and have not attached completed application.

!image-20240401-180045.png|width=354,height=147,alt="image-20240401-180045.png"!



# This is for SL (Lender role) when they try to transmit and have not completed the ‘mandatory’ fields.

!image-20240401-180219.png|width=354,height=250,alt="image-20240401-180219.png"!



# SL or CR role when decision has not been made

!image-20240401-181056.png|width=356,height=128,alt="image-20240401-181056.png"!



Another ticket 670 is allowing to keep the Compliance questions unanswered.    This ticket should should change the second message when advisor is trying to transmit to SL or SL is trying to transmit by saying:



{color:#ff991f}Test Success Criteria{color}

New Message (For advisor transmitting to SL, or SL transmitting to CR or other role)



WARNING!  You have not completed the following fields listed below.   Transmitting to the next step without completing these required fields may cause delays.   Do you still want to transmit?

OK / Cancel buttons

column1: Remove compliance questions as being mandatory to save
column32:
Background:

Sometimes, the advisor just wants to save some client details or Lender just wants to import scan, without 

having to enter the Compliance questions (which will be reviewed by ADMIN).

Therefore, the system should be able to save, without the Compliance section populated (Don’t want to click to populate all to typical answers, without checking).

column1: Reduce the # of mandatory fields for saving
column32:
Background:

Advisors sometimes does not have all the information, so should be able to save without having to complete all the information.

Also on import scan, not all client information is populated and reviewed by lender - this will be completed by Admin.   All they want to do is to import, check certain details are accurate to pull credit bureau and then save.

Therefore, only the following fields are mandatory for saving:

* First Name
* Last Name

Currently, also need the Compliance fields to save.

column1: Enable Insurance Policies as Collateral for Investment Loan
column32:
Background:

We added new feature such that a client who wants an investment loan can now use the cash surrender value (CSV) of a life insurance policy and assign as collateral for the 25% equity portion.  Normally, if a client wants an investment loan (3:1), they need to put up 1 part for every 3 parts DUCA funds.  So for example, if they want a $75,000 loan from us, they need to put in $25,000 for a total investment of $100,000.  But with Life Insurance, we can give them the $75,000 loan if they put their life insurance policy with CSV value of $25,000 or more and assign it to DUCA.



Test success criteria

# Add Life Insurance in the Drop down for collateral security.   (Note that for investment loans, there will always be a second collateral - normally Segregated Funds)
# In the new Investment Loan application, for advisor entering on Business Banker, need to map to this field on the PDF application

!image-20240320-204938.png|width=701,height=260!

# When import scan, need to map to Business Banker, the collateral, that its a life insurance policy and the policy number to the inline Collateral Security.  Again, there should be 2 lines - a blank line with the Security Number and a second Line with Life Insurance policy and Life insurance policy number



# Need to ensure the Life Insurance collateral is automatically assigned to 3:1  - the checkbox

!image-20240320-205257.png|width=588,height=382!

column1: Enable Seg Fund as collateral for Investment Loans on Business Banker
column32:
Background:

Today, on Business Banker, we allow for Mutual Funds / ETFs known as ‘Investments’ - where the loan money goes, which we use as collateral security.

In this case, we have the security document named SCA (Security Control Agreement) which is nicely mapped based on dealer of the advisor.

Objective:

We need to allow for a loan money going to Segregated Funds which will be used as collateral security.   We already have Segregated Funds in the Collateral Security Drop down for Investment Loans.  The loan money can go into Segregated Funds.   In this case, the security document is AHAD (NOT SCA)



{color:#008da6}Test success criteria{color}



# In the Inline, the Security Account Number is optional (not a required field).   (Background - the advisor will not know up front and will leave it blank.  However they will complete it later and have client sign a second version of application.)
## So perhaps we have logic such that {color:#ff991f}*if* {color}the Security Account Number is blank, the investment loan Docusign does not request borrower(s) to initial.  If it is populated, then the investment loan Docusign requests borrower(s) to initial like today.   See image below of the section 7.   {color:#006644}We can discuss{color}

# In the Inline, remove the Description Field - it is currently mandatory and in most cases, it is not needed.  This is for all collateral security that we can remove.
# For Segregated funds as collateral for investment loan, default to Equitable Life as the Life insurer and only have Equitable Life in drop down.  (NOTE that this behaviour is only for Investment Loans).   For MSLOC and IFA, you can show all the insurers

# Default check the “Assigned to Loan” checkbox for 3:1 Investment Loan (It should always be defaulted to 3:1 or MSLOC or IFA
# Hide ‘Contract Type' if system does not need it.  Don’t need it from business perspective as it is always Segregated Fund.  

# AHAD document is mapped and shown instead of SCA (See attached)
# Equitable Acknowledgement form is mapped and populated (See attached)
# Both AHAD and Equitable can be sent via Docusign as follows:
## AHAD is sent to Borrower 1, Borrower 2 (if applicable), then advisor as Witness 
## Equitable Acknowledgement form is sent to Borrower 1, Borrower 2 (if applicable) 

See attachments in separate email

# Test import scan.  When import scan of investment loan application, there is no way to tell whether it is a seg fund or investments, so leave that blank, but populate the Security Account Number and the Value.

18/Apr/24 10:33 PM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;[~accountid:712020:261c0e4a-8bb5-4085-8acf-bde7f3f8ada3] [~accountid:62b55f5ad337d0b7d09eb9e2] 



Everything is good except for one thing.   The Contract / Policy number takes precedent in the Investment Loan app, AHAD and Equitable Acknowledgement.

What I mean is that the only time the application number should populate in the PDFs is that when the Seg Fund Policy /Contract Number field is NOT populated.   Otherwise, it should always populate with the Contract/Policy Number (or in BB also named as the Security Account Number in line.

So to summarize,  

# If the Application number field is populated in Business Banker, but not the contract number, then the Application number should populate in PDFs (Investment Loan App, AHAD and Equitable Acknowledgement)
# If the Application number field is {color:#ff5630}not {color}populated in Business Banker, but the contract number is populated, then the contract number should populate in PDFs (Investment Loan App, AHAD and Equitable Acknowledgement)
# If {color:#36b37e}both {color}the Application number field is populated and the contract number is populated in Business Banker, then populate the contract number only in PDFs (Investment Loan App, AHAD and Equitable Acknowledgement)



A. in the Investment Loan application

It looks like only this situation where only the Application number is populated below.

!image-20240419-020436.png|width=1261,height=391,alt="image-20240419-020436.png"!

B. Same logic for the Equitable Acknowledgement.  In this case, it captures the Policy Number, but what happens if only the application number field is completed?



!image-20240419-021506.png|width=1350,height=467,alt="image-20240419-021506.png"!



C. Same for AHAD

In this case, it captures both, but if the contract/ policy number is populated, don’t populate the application number (circled in red).  Only if the contract number is not populated, that the Application number field is populated.



!image-20240419-022219.png|width=1329,height=333,alt="image-20240419-022219.png"!

column1: New Applications - Investment Loan
column32:
New applications have been created.    We need to map and be able to import scan these new applications.    

For Investment Loan, there is a new field added on page 9, section 7.   Its called Life Insurance Policy Number.

!image-20240315-174855.png|width=703,height=260!



So for the advisor, they can go in and select ‘Life Insurance’ in Description of the Security under Collateral Security - currently for Investment Loan, only have Investment Loan and Segregated Funds.  Then all the pertinent fields for Life Insurance will appear when user clicks on '…' 

Similarly, if user imports scans, this needs to be mapped in Collateral Security

!image-20240315-175829.png|width=824,height=322!

Test Success Criteria

# Advisor able to add Life Insurance as a Collateral Security - (last in the list preferably, but not first)
# This will also default check the box to Assign the collateral to the Investment Loan
# User able to import scan and this Collateral Security is mapped in Business Banker with the Description and the Account Number populated in Collateral Security (as well as the Investments OR Segregated Funds as security) - so there are 2 collateral securities when Life Insurance Field is populated.
# The Life Insurance Collateral Security is mapped to Booking Slip
# The Collateral Security on Booking Slip is mapped to DNA
# Assignment of Life Insurance Policy document is populated when life insurance collateral is present
# Acknowledgment of life insurance policy document is populated when life insurance collateral is present

column1: Need to develop a new function for AI (test by Marie-Claude)
Open up more fields in Booking Slip for SLA role
column32:
Most fields need to be opened up in case there is an error earlier on in the process.   The fields on the Booking Slip will go to DNA, so this is the final step before DNA.    Don’t need to update the original Loan Request fields if update Booking Slip.

The fields in red, should be opened and available for Edit by SLA role {color:#ff991f}only.   {color}So same defaults as today, but editable.

There should also be drop downs for 

* Major (Consumer, Commercial)
* Minor (For example, Personal IFA (Standard) - L724; Personal IFA (DBL) - L725; Personal IFA (Streamlined) - L726 etc.

* Ownership Type (Single, Joint AND, Joint OR)

LCLA should be based on the Major and Minor Codes above from the Booking Slip - so if user changes, it should reflect appropriately.



Again, the data on the Booking Slip will be the values going to DNA.  So may need to remap some fields so the API grabs values from Booking Slip.

!image-20240308-190354.png|width=658,height=584!

# The drop down for Place of registration should be same as what is in drop down for ID



!image-20240715-224041.png|width=600,height=287,alt="image-20240715-224041.png"!

Should be Ontario first, followed by other provinces and territories in alphabetical order





!image-20240715-224140.png|width=590,height=320,alt="image-20240715-224140.png"!

#  Set defaults to fields as per attached requirements 

Entity is a tax resident of Canada = Yes

Entity is a tax resident of the US = No

Entity is a tax resident of a jurisdiction other than Canada or US = No

Entity is a money services business; OR does the entity…. = No

Country of Incorporation = Default to Canada



# Change label “Entity Classification'“ to 

*Entity Classification  (bold)*

The entity…

#  The drop down needs to be in the following sequence:

* has shares regularly traded on an established securities exchange
* has less than 50% of gross income from passive investments
* is a government, central bank or an international organization
* is an active non-financial entity other than one described in the 3 previous options
* is a passive non-financial entity

column1: Clarification of Current Loan vs. New Loan
column26: Package 4 - October - Margin, QC Checks, Docusign
column32:
We need to improve clarity of previous, current and new loans.



For example, if client has 4 loans.   They have taken 2 investment loans in the past and have one underway, but want a new one, how will Business banker display this situation?

!image-20240212-211412.png|width=1035,height=514!



Perhaps, it is

User (Advisor or SL), clicks on Client name in the list

Sees links as follows:

# Previous Loans (Drop down of date and Loan type they were funded?)
# Current Loans (Drop down of date and Loan type they were started?)
# New Loan (creates new loan)

column1: When add new loan to existing user, blank out Credit Facility and Collateral Security
column32:
When advisor or SL selects existing client and then clicks ‘New Loan Request' to create a new loan, the system should copy the Client details, assets, liabilities, income, other obligations, additional details (allow for these fields to be edited), however, remove previous loan requests:

# Collateral Security
# Credit Facility
# Decisions
# Documentations

These should only show when previous loan is selected.

column1: Advisor tab should be editable
column32:
For advisor role 2 (not advisor role 1), the Advisor should be able to select from drop down in the Advisor Tab, the advisor role 1 or others in same branch like they can under the Client section.   Right now, there is no way to edit except for going back to edit the Client.   

Also not sure that the Advisor section should be within the Client section.   We should discuss.

Finally the Advisor tab, they should only be able to select the advisor.   There should be a message that if they are trying to change details such as address etc., to reach out.   We can discuss.

column1: Assets and Liabilities do not get adjusted when add or delete loan
column32:
16)   If you create a loan request and then subsequently delete it the original loan amount remains in the assets and liabilities

 

However (and likely more important) you cannot add a new loan request

 

Similar issue when you create a Security then delete it and try to add a new security – creates a line for security but you cannot add anything

column1: Edits and Boundaries in certain fields
column32:
First payment date should have future boundary of say 3 months

The Years at Residence should have limit of 2 digits plus 2 decimal places (i.e. 99.99 years)

Employer years working there should have limit of 2 digits plus 2 decimal places (i.e. 99.99 years)

column1: The Final Interest Rate on booking slip should be disabled
column32: The final interest rate is based on the SL Prime/Base Rate % + Adjusted Rate %.   It should therefore be disabled and just calculate based on the above two rates.

column1: Add option of Blended Payment on Booking Slip
column32:
Currently, the choices are 

# Interest Only
# P&I (fixed payment)

We don’t want to allow advisors to select Blended Payment, however, upon request, we need to be able to indicate that on Booking Slip.

So 

# in the Balance Type field, it should be editable and have a drop down with:

* Note Interest (Int only)
* Note Balance (Fixed Principal + Int)



2. In the Payment Type field, it should be editable

* Variable Calculated Interest (Int Only)
* Fixed Balance (Fixed Principal)

We checked on Canada CENTRAL only. Would need to check for all inscope regions. 

Issue 2.2.1 : On canada Central, volumes are encrypted by default. There is notehing else to do.  We could do prevention as suggested for other regions, it is a good practice.  We could check if it is encrypted for the other environments (Paris, ex.). In the future, we could operationalise  this recommedations for new regions.

column1: Amendment Process
column32:
Sometimes, after Credit risk has approved, the lender wants to provide an amendment for CR to review again.

Ideally for Credit Risk, the changes are highlighted and statuses tracked i.e. Approved, and then now Amendment, and then Approved again.

Let’s design this process (mockup) and provide to the Credit Risk and Lending team for review.

column1: SOC2 Review Results from Hostedscan (scan done on Jan 15, 2024)
column245:
22/Jan/24 10:24 AM;70121:a2dd7e75-6319-4926-91a5-74785bb6ee3d;Reviewed the high one with JP1:  {{SSL/TLS: Report Vulnerable Cipher Suites for HTTPS}}

Right now there are no load balancers,  we would need to look at the config on the server.  Before it was configured by AWS on the load balancer.  With the architecture change to EC2, we need to take care of it.
column246:
13/Feb/24 11:15 AM;70121:a2dd7e75-6319-4926-91a5-74785bb6ee3d;About Hosted scan 

Required because of SOC2 - SO17 control: Vulnerability scan is performed on a quarterly basis to identify threats and vulnerabilities to the production systems. Issues identified are analyzed and remediated in a timely manner.

For this we have 4 complementary tools. 

*Guarduty :* Amazon GuardDuty is a threat detection service that continuously monitors your AWS accounts and workloads for malicious activity and delivers detailed security findings for visibility and remediation.

*Sonarcloud :* to scan code. 

*Hosted Scan* to do this :

It makes attempts from an external perspective to automaticcaly find exploit paths (it is not neccessrily exploitable, but should correct for best practices):  

* Find insecure software and scan for Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs).
* *Ensure your firewall and network are configured correctly wit*h nothing unintentionally exposed.
* Focus on your web application, and detects front-end and API vulnerabilities.
* Analyzes your SSL/TLS configuration and detects bad certificates, weak ciphers etc.
* Manage Github Dependabot vulnerabilities in one place.
* *Scan your APIs* for potential weaknesses and security vulnerabilities.
* Centralize risks for your containers alongside your scans.
* Bring in any third party risk source using our API.
* It includes Dynamic Scan [https://hostedscan.com/dast-scan|https://hostedscan.com/dast-scan|smart-link] 

*AWS Inspector:*

It looks for OS and S/W versions on Servers, and check it there are existing vulnerabilities and automatically flags them for us.
column247: 13/Feb/24 11:17 AM;70121:a2dd7e75-6319-4926-91a5-74785bb6ee3d;[~accountid:712020:261c0e4a-8bb5-4085-8acf-bde7f3f8ada3] I updated Jira. Tell me if you have questions.  You need to bring that up at our Thursday Meeting 6 am.

column1: Add Welcome Email via Docusign
column26: Package 3 - July - UPLOC, Bridge, Corp Inv Loan; Welcome Packages
column32:
Once Funding is complete and the Funder has transmitted file to SLA role (Admin), the Admin should be able to with a click of a button on Business Banker, generate a Welcome Email using Docusign.

The email via docusign will contain the following with dynamic text or documents highlighted in red.



*Re: [*{color:#ff5630}*Investment Loan/Margin Secured Line of Credit/Immediate Financing Arrangement Line of Credit]*{color} *for [*{color:#ff5630}*Enter Name of Corporation if applicable]*{color}

 

 

Dear [{color:#ff5630}Borrower name(s)/ Owner Names{color}]*,*

 

We would like to welcome you to DUCA Financial Services.  Thank you for opening your above noted {color:#ff5630}*[Investment Loan/Margin Secured Line of Credit/Immediate Financing Arrangement Line of Credit]*{color}{color:#ff5630} {color}with us on [{color:#ff5630}Funding date{color}]

 

We have attached to this email a copy of your {color:#ff5630}*[Investment Loan/MSLOC/IFA Application]*{color}{color:#ff5630} {color}, and {color:#ff5630}*[Security Control Agreement/Assignment of Life Insurance Policy/Assignment of Contract of Annuity, Commitment Letter]*{color} forms. We have also attached a FSRA Brochure containing general information regarding Deposit Insurance Coverage. Please download for your records.

 

Your first monthly Interest-Only payment is [{color:#ff5630}Payment Amount] {color}due on [{color:#ff5630}first payment date{color}]and is based on the initial advance of  {color:#ff5630}[Total Disbursement $]{color}. This payment and all future payments will be debited from your designated account provided to DUCA on the [{color:#ff5630}first or 15th{color}] of every month.

Monthly statements are available through Online Banking. To set up your Online Banking, please contact us at 1-833-932-2016 and a representative will be happy to help.

We appreciate your business and look forward to hearing from you.



Sincerely,

 

DUCA Financial Services Credit Union Ltd.

Specialized Lending Administration Team.

column1: Update DNA with weekly Security Values from Partners
column32:
Collateral Security Values are added to DNA manually for all investment loans and investment secured MSLOCs.    This ticket is to have DNA updated each week with the Partner provided data.



The idea is that a new report is added in the Reports section only available to the SLA role

User selects Update Security Values in the reports menu (maybe after Margin Report at bottom)

Report Appears - see image below

The report highlights records which based on the LTV difference, appears something is wrong.   The threshold is set at + or - 5% (and perhaps can be controlled by user?)

There is a button that the user can then ‘Push to DNA’

Once updated, the system reports updated values which would now have 0% Differences in LTV column for all the records and the Before and After Security values and LTVs the same.



Success Criteria

# User triggers bulk update
# DNA confirms updated
# Business Banker provides report with following fields:
## Loan Number {color:#006644}(From Business Banker Loan Import file{color})
## Credit Facility # ({color:#006644}From Business Banker/{color}{color:#ff991f}From DNA{color})
## Current Balance ({color:#006644}From Business Banker Loan Import file){color}
## Security Value before update ({color:#ff991f}from DNA{color})
## LTV before update ({color:#4c9aff}calculation - Balance/Security Value before{color})
## Security Value after update ({color:#006644}from Partner data imported{color})
## LTV after update ({color:#4c9aff}calculation - Balance/ Security Value after{color})
## LTV difference ({color:#4c9aff}calculation - LTV After - LTV Before{color})

column1: When display client, the co-borrower should be under the Borrower (and indented and not clickable)
column32:
User clicked on co-borrower and added loan details instead of borrower resulting in confusion.    Suggest that the co-borrower be under and indented from borrower and not clickable perhaps.   OR perhaps there is a borrower and then a co-borrower column.  Right now, no indication of primary or coborrower

This way, each record would be essentially a loan.

!image-20240315-203151.png|width=891,height=100!

If we added a co-borrower column, then the user knows which is borrower/ co borrower and the loan they have together.    If Co-Borrower gets a loan, then they’d be the primary borrower

Searching for client would bring up the client who are involved as borrower or co-borrower.

So e.g. John Smith can list as follows (assuming 3 loans)

*Borrower*     *Co-Borrower   Client Type etc.*

John Smith                              I

Jane Smith     John Smith       I

John Smith    Kaley Smith      I

column246:
18/Jan/24 10:25 AM;70121:a2dd7e75-6319-4926-91a5-74785bb6ee3d;Comments from Richard afterwards

Good morning

 

The deployment was successful.  Thanks everyone!

 

However a few things

 

# Auto attach of completed docusign document did not work at beginning– it was fixed right away with manual config, but I recalled that there should not be a problem anymore as we are putting in a permanent config?   Can you advise?   Also, can this happen in production by itself or is it only at time of a release where perhaps a config file is overwritten?
# New JIRA 602 was opened to address situation where advisor added say 3 documents through drag and drop.   Then when they transmit to SL, the 3 attachments appear and an additional line (duplicate) with no attachment appears.

 

Also we discussed, that the fix for deleting the 3 PENtest users was not completed (still can’t delete) – this is a lower priority, but just wanted to correct the note below

 

Thanks again!

 

Regards

Richard

column1: Change such that advisor does not need to sign back in and Lender gets notified once all documents attached
column32:
Currently advisor signs into BB, then completes all fields and sends for Docusign.   Then afterwards, they have to sign in just to transmit.

Can system send notification to Lender, after transmit and all documents are completed AND if after 2 days, there are no application and SCA completed, that it messages the Lender to follow up with the advisor.



# Once advisor transmit, 
## If application is attached, lender gets notified right away (like today)
## If application is attached within 48 hours, let lender know
## If application is not attached, after 2 days (48 hours) Lender gets notified via email, that an application is pending.

18/Mar/24 6:52 PM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;[~accountid:62b55f5ad337d0b7d09eb9e2] [~accountid:712020:261c0e4a-8bb5-4085-8acf-bde7f3f8ada3] 

How does the messaging work? I get the following only after the App was attached (but after I had submitted).   I don’t get message in the following:

# Right after advisor submits (without application attached)
# Right after advisor submits (with application attached)

Also the message grammar is not correct for the scenario where advisor transmits without application attached and then the application is attached afterwards… 



Need to update to have

{color:#ff991f}[Advisor name] {color}submitted a new 3 to 1 Investment Loan application for client Lena Lion for your review



A new 3 to 1 Investment Loan application for client Lena Lion (Client number 55) has now been attached in Business Banker and ready for your review.

Please log into Business Banker and review the new loan application.   

Or you can copy the following link and paste into the browser.

[LINK]

This message is sent from an automated mailbox and is not monitored.

!image-20240318-224005.png|width=244,height=437!

----

For the situation where advisor transmits without application (first email prior to above), it should say

{color:#ff991f}[Advisor name] {color}is preparing a new 3 to 1 Investment Loan application for client Lena Lion



A new 3 to 1 Investment Loan application for client Lena Lion (Client number 55) is being prepared.  It is not yet ready for your review as the application has not yet been attached.

We will send you another email know once the application has been attached and ready for your review.



This message is sent from an automated mailbox and is not monitored.



----

Finally, if the application is attached when advisor transmits to Lender, the message should say:



{color:#ff991f}[Advisor name] {color}submitted a new 3 to 1 Investment Loan application for client Lena Lion for your review



A new 3 to 1 Investment Loan application for client Lena Lion (Client number 55) has been submitted and ready for your review.

Please log into Business Banker and review the new loan application.   

Or you can copy the following link and paste into the browser.

[LINK]

This message is sent from an automated mailbox and is not monitored.

column262:
01/Feb/24 6:15 PM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;[~accountid:62b55f5ad337d0b7d09eb9e2] [~accountid:626ebda502e1c10069bb9ced] Umair, please advise if you need anything and Atif can help (Thanks Atif!)

In business terms, 

# Contract/ Funding date is entered by user in booking slip
# The First Due date is the first of the next month if the Contract day is the 21st or earlier.   {color:#006644}_For example, if Contract Date is January 18, 2024, then the first payment date is defaulted to February 1, 2024 (there is enough time to pull a payment)._  {color}   If Contract day is 22nd or later, then the First Due date is the first of the following month. {color:#36b37e} {color}{color:#006644}_For example, if Contract Date is January 23, 2024, then the first payment date is defaulted to March 1, 2024._ {color}{color:#006644} {color} {color:#ff991f}This field is editable on booking slip.   {color}Currently, the first due date is pulled from Credit Facility, but should be based on the date entered in the Contract/Funding Date in booking slip.
# The Maturity Date is the term (e.g. 30 years for investment loans) +*less*+ 1 month.   F{color:#006644}_or example, if the First Due Date is February 1, 2024, then the Maturity Date with term of 30 years is January 1, 2054._ {color}  {color:#006644} {color} {color:#ff991f}This field is editable on booking slip.  {color}Currently, the maturity date is pulled from Credit Facility (and based on term) most likely but should be based on the First Due date entered in the Booking slip.
column263:
05/Feb/24 8:50 AM;62b55f5ad337d0b7d09eb9e2;[~accountid:62741546106b60006f5964c5] what i understand from your points:

1- Currently *First Due Date* is comming from facility’s *First Payment Date*,
You want to change *First Due Date* of bookingslip based on *Contract (Funding) Date* like,
if *Contract (Funding) Date* < 22nd => *January 18, 2024*
then *First payment date* is *February 1, 2024*

if *Contract (Funding) Date* is 22nd or later => *January 23, 2024*
then *First payment date* is *March 1, 2024*

2- Currently *Maturity Date* of bookingslip is facility’s *First Payment Date + 30 Years*
but you want to configure it according *First Due Date* of bookingslip +  *30 Years.*
Kindly correct me if i misunderstood.
column264:
05/Feb/24 9:13 AM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;[~accountid:62b55f5ad337d0b7d09eb9e2] 

#1 is correct.   If contract funding day is from January 1 - January 22, 2024, then the first payment date is February 1, 2024.

#2 should be First payment date + term, - 1 month.   For example, if First Payment Date is February 1, 2024, and the term is 30 years, then the Maturity Date should be {color:#ff991f}January {color}1, 20{color:#ff991f}5{color}4

We can discuss,

Collateral Description 1

Collateral Type 2

Collateral Value 2

column254:
09/Jan/24 9:17 AM;62b55f5ad337d0b7d09eb9e2;[~accountid:62741546106b60006f5964c5]  The issue is : 
advisor create 
borrower : *Test jan 4 again* => same branch as advisor
co-borrower : *Debra testdebra*  => same branch as advisor
then create *new client* with same branch as advisor and set his as a co-borrower in Debra testdebra
then SL change branch of newely created client.

That’s why when advisor try to fetch *Debra testdebra* client it also fetch co-borrower of that client that has different branch.
it has no acces.
column255:
10/Jan/24 9:30 AM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;[~accountid:62b55f5ad337d0b7d09eb9e2] - thanks for explanation.   

I tested and looks good.

I tested the following

# Advisor from Castlemoore creates loan with 2 clients - “A” and “B” (B is from existing)
# Advisor from Mandeville creates loan with 2 clients - ‘C' and 'D’ (D is from existing)
# Confirmed that the search only finds clients within Castlemoore and within Mandeville (and also within AD1 or AD2 profiles - i.e. if AD2, can see all clients created in same branch; if AD1, can only see own customers)
# If SL then were to go in and select a client from another branch/dealer, and advisor signs back in, they will not see the client.



So this scenario should never happen and so okay as is.

column1: SOC2 Controls for EC2-based architecture
column32:
Summary of discussion with JP1, to ensure security and compliance to SOC2 we will need the following 

1- Ensure that the backups are done (probably with Microsoft SQL, Zain will be to program it) (it was handled by ECS) 

2-EDR : it will require a “Crowstrike” per server. Previously, the servers were managed by AWS, and they were responsible for endpoint security. Now, it will be us, not AWS, who will take care of it.

3- We need to have the following alarm points, some of which have been added: 

* alarms that monitor EC2 resources (CPU, RAM, disk space, network) (AWS ECS was surveilling disk space and network, now we have to do it) 
* alarms that monitor database: (whether the backups have worked correctly, if the database service is functioning)
column245:
02/Nov/23 10:23 AM;70121:a2dd7e75-6319-4926-91a5-74785bb6ee3d;Database is still on ECS.  

Backup are still handled by AWS backup services wtill.  

2- will install Crowdstrike on each server in the next few days. It is a 15 min task.  

3-a)Alarms that monitor EC2 resources needs to be added. week of Nov 6.  

3.b)Alarms for ECS, remains the same.
column246:
08/Jan/24 8:54 AM;70121:a2dd7e75-6319-4926-91a5-74785bb6ee3d;Update:

2-EDR , to check if implemented

3-a)CPU alarm is there, RAM alarm missing, disk space alarm missing, don’t need network (could monitor quantité importante de données qui sortent de la production, mais peut-être pas assez d’utilisateurs et guarduty regarde cela, ex en temp normal on a x données qui sortent par heure, et là on a 3-4 fois plus)   

3-b) backup fail alarm is still there.

column1: Usability - Cannot update 2 clients consecutively without clicking Save
column32:
As user, since the Save button is at bottom of page, and if they want to edit both clients (need to after import scan to complete compliance questions), after editing and updating the first client, they may choose to click on second client (without saving).   In this case, it should auto save so to not lose the changes for the first client.



Perhaps an extra Save button after Client 1 if cannot auto save?

column1: Reporting - Report of users logging in
column32:
Create report of users logging in.    Fields of the detailed report include

# User ID
# Role of user
# Day of log in 
# Time of Log in (Eastern Time)
# Duration of Log in

Summary report includes:

# List of User IDs and roles logged in, in a calendar month
# Number times a particular user id logged in

We need the Member(s) to be added to DNA first before Add Loan.  

Suggest having some kind of check, similar to how a decision needs to be made before transmitting, to remind SLA role to add member(s) to DNA (and to get back a Member ID for each client).



Suggest wording to say: 

Member(s) have not been added to DNA.   Please add member(s) to DNA before transmitting.

column1: SOC2: Replace Angular JS Version 1.8.3
column32:
To analyse from business point of view.  Big change.

It is the last version (April 7, 2022) , but it is at its end of life.  

IMPACT: 

* it is not supported anymore, the security issues and bugs are not fixed anymore. 
* Will be raised by next pen test

Plan the replacement to avoid being in an emergency when someone finds a vulnerability.  It is a big change.  

Could it be updated by sections? 

To spread the project over 6-9 months? 

  

There are advantages from a development point of view.
column245: 02/Oct/23 10:15 AM;70121:a2dd7e75-6319-4926-91a5-74785bb6ee3d;Linked to [https://cognitivegroup.atlassian.net/browse/BUS-416|https://cognitivegroup.atlassian.net/browse/BUS-416|smart-link]

column1: SOC2 : CSP Header is absent
column32:
*From Hostscan report Sept 17, 2023* 

*CSP Header (medium)*: Content Security Policy Header is absent. Because this is absent, if there is a vulnerabillity, malicious people could insert their own script, image, styles into Business Banker. It is usually strongly recommended for our type of application. Someone could modify a script that we use from a tier, and we could affected by that. If we load script, images, style from our servers mostly, it should be simple to implement to add.



Details: [https://cognitivegroup.atlassian.net/browse/BUS-416|https://cognitivegroup.atlassian.net/browse/BUS-416|smart-link]

column1: SOC 2 :Add CRSF Token
column32:
As a result from Hostscan June and Sept, we need to add CRSF token. 

1-Troy Hunt, Most Valuable Professional at Microsoft:

[https://www.troyhunt.com/owasp-top-10-for-net-developers-part-5/|https://www.troyhunt.com/owasp-top-10-for-net-developers-part-5/|smart-link]

2- OWASP

[https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/csrf|https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/csrf|smart-link]

3_Microsoft

[https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/security/anti-request-forgery?view=aspnetcore-7.0|https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/security/anti-request-forgery?view=aspnetcore-7.0|smart-link]

*According to Zain*: “we haven’t implemented those as our login method doesn’t support http only cookies at the moment.” 

*According to Jean-Philippe Rivard Lauzier:* He checked for Cognito, and CSRF is present there, and we miss it for the application in general. Maybe there something about your comment that he does not understand, if yes, can you elaborate?

column1: Review Results from Hostedscan (scan done on Sept 18, 2023)
column32:
Problems from Sept 18, 2023 Hostedscan, Jean-Philippe Rivard Lauzier’s review: 

*1- CSRF Token (medium)* : absent

*2- Angular JS version 1.8.3*  (medium) : it is the last version (April 7, 2022) , but it is at its end of life.  IMPACT: it is not supported anymore, the security issues and bugs are not fixed anymore. ACTION: Plan the replacement to avoid being in an emergency when someone finds a vulnerability.  It is a big change.  Could it be updated by sections? TO spread the project over 6-9 months?   

*3- CSP Header (medium)*: Content Security Policy Header is absent.  Because this is absent, if there is a vulnerabillity, malicious people could insert their own script, image, styles into Business Banker.   It is usually strongly recommended for our type of application.  Someone could modify a script that we use from a tier, and we could affected by that.  If we load script, images, style from our servers mostly, it should be simple to implement to add.    

-4-- *-On-* [*-DUCA.Bbanker.Ca-*|http://DUCA.Bbanker.Ca] *-frontend is hosted on S3 (medium), a-*-nd report that it is hosted on S3.  FALSE POSITIVE.- 

-5--*-VIA TCP, we can determine when the server has been running (the up-time) (LOW)-*-. It is low.  Don’t know what a malicious person can do with this.  According to research, there are Pros and Cons to deactivate the feature.-  

-6-- *-Open port-* -(medium).  Http, and https are open.  This is a normal situation as these ports nbeed to be open to access application. Nothing to do.- 

When we do a pen test, #1, #2, # 3 will be reported.

Discussion with Zain: 

1- Already started can be done this week or soon. 

2-Needs Analysis and planning, from business side. Front-end need to be entirely re-written. Advantages from Development to go to latest version too.

column1: Usability - Add Members to DNA
column32:
When there are two members/ borrowers, user needs to add one at a time.   And it is not clear/intuitive.

Also, when the first member is added, there is no button or link to add second borrower.  User has to click on the Banner, find the client and go through the same process.

Suggest:

# User clicks on ‘Add [{color:#ff991f}Client 1 Name{color}] to DNA’ - notice the client name is dynamic
# After the first one is added (after search functionality to make sure no duplicate), a pop-up /message says something like '[{color:#ff991f}Client 1 Name{color}] added.   Add [{color:#ff991f}Client 2 name{color}] to DNA?

18/Oct/23 12:32 PM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;[~accountid:5fe1ffaba9d030010747a650] [~accountid:626ebda502e1c10069bb9ced] So Atif and I tested and there are some improvements needed…

The way it should work is if SIN matches, then bring the record(s) with same SIN for user to choose.

Else If no SIN Match, then check for FN, LN and DOB and bring up those record(s) that match these 3 criteria.

Else if no SIN Match and no FN, LN and DOB match, then bring up those record(s) that have FN and LN match.



Here are the scenarios tested and the results as examples:

# When we entered a matching First Name, Last Name, DOB and SIN, it brings up all records with the same First and Last name.   It should only bring up the one record which matches First name, last name, DOB and SIN.   (This is same behaviour when we have FN, LN and SIN match, it brings up all records with same FN and LN - should only bring up the one record with FN, LN and SIN match)
# When we have FN, LN and DOB match, it should only bring up that one record and not other records with different DOBs.
# When we have SIN match only (no FN, LN, DOB), no record shows up - it should bring up the one record with the matching SIN.  (Similarly, when FN, DOB and SIN Match, it should bring up the one record as it should match on SIN only).   However, we do get a message when trying to create a record in DNA.  Wonder why it shows no records, and yet brings up this message?    

!image-20231018-163208.png|width=937,height=546!
column254: 20/Oct/23 1:01 PM;5fe1ffaba9d030010747a650;[~accountid:62741546106b60006f5964c5] The error only appears when the SIN matches with a user in DNA, it doesn’t allow duplicates.
column255: 20/Oct/23 1:27 PM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;[~accountid:5fe1ffaba9d030010747a650] Agree, but about the error message, but then it should bring up the record and display it.  So I assume the logic is not correct right now.
column256:
20/Oct/23 1:58 PM;5fe1ffaba9d030010747a650;The record will appear in the popup you see.

As you know search by SIN is not enabled in the Testing env of Celero at the moment. However, you can ask Celero to enable it.

column1: Margin Report - Record is showing when it should not in certain situation
column26: Package 4 - October - Margin, QC Checks, Docusign
column32:
Scenario:

If record breaches, goes over 100% LTV, and then it goes under 99%, which takes it off breach it needs to go over 100% again to be included in breach.   We have a record where it went over 100%, went under 99% and now it is 99.5% or so (under 100%) and so should not be on list.

Also keep in mind that once it breaches, it has to go under 99% before it gets off breach..

column1: Add Miscellaneous Page for DNA - Booking Slip
column32:
This page is only available to Admin (SLA) and funders and is required on every deal.   This page would save time for admin team.



The following fields should be shown, allowing for updates and data entry if required - linked to Jira 496 - prepopulate wire form



Headings are in orange

{color:#ff991f}Final Loan Details ({color}{color:#ff991f}_Entered by Lender/admin?_{color}{color:#ff991f}) after approval{color}

* Credit Limit or Loan Amount 
* Rate Adjustment factor (premium or discount) 
* Authorized Amount
* Personal or Corporate  {color:#006644}(Selection - Default by Business Banker?){color}
* Loan Classification and Minor Code (Drop down based on Personal or Corporate selection above with following:)
** Personal selected
*** 10 - Personal Investment Loan - L722 
*** 12 - Personal MSLOC - L723 
*** 13 - Personal IFA (Standard) - L724
*** 15 - Personal IFA (DBL) - L725
*** 16 - Personal IFA (Streamlined) - L726
*** 17 - Personal UPLOC - L727
*** 18 - Personal Bridge - L746
** Commercial selected
*** 12 - Corporate MSLOC - B882
*** 13 - Corporate IFA (Standard) - B883
*** 15 - Corporate IFA (DBL) - B884
*** 16 - Corporate IFA (Streamlined) - B885
* Collateral Security Value
* Collateral Security Details/description (Investment Account Name and Account # or Insurance Name and Policy # )
* Maturity Date (default based on booking/funding/disbursement date - 10 years for IFA and 30 years for Interest only for investment loans; MSLOC 30 years with access for user to change) 
* First Payment Due Date
* Repayment Amount - Interest Only (system) or Blended or fixed Principle (indicated by user)

{color:#ff991f}Closing Details{color}

* Funding Date / Closing Date - populated when administrator clicks on Add Loan in Business Banker.  (not manually entered)
* Total Disbursement amount 
* Disbursement Amount _(What sending to member) - could be 1 to many adding to the total disbursement amount - suggest being able to add more than 1_
* Offsetting Deposit/DUCA Account
* Disbursement Method (Wire or Bank Draft)
* Scheduled Review Date for MSLOC and IFA (default 1 year after disbursement for investment loan with ability for user to update)
* Authorizer - who is approver from Credit Risk (could be Michael, or Nishant or Jonathan - drop down with ability to add/remove others maybe maintained by Admin users?)
* PPSA registration #
* PPSA Expiry Date
