19/Oct/23 2:50 PM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;[~accountid:70121:6b338a5b-9f37-4a24-b8c4-d9e87056fce7] Hi Francois

Here is some feedback based on the mockup .  Can you produce in Stage and we can iterate?

# Change Tab Name to ‘Summary’
# Change title to Final Loan Information
# Can we Edit first and then click on Add Loan to DNA?
# Change label to Credit Limit/ Loan Amount
# Change Sequence of fields to as follows (there are some additional fields) and with subheadings underlined and bold.  Default from other information collected as much as possible and allow for edits:

!image-20231019-183956.png|width=1409,height=663!



+*Loan Type and Amount*+

* Major Type (Commercial/Consumer)
* Loan Classification
* Ownership Type (Joint And/ Joint Or / Single)
* Credit Limit / Loan Amount
* Authorized Amount
* Disburse Funds at Finish? (Yes/No)



+*Repayment and Rate*+

* Rate Adjustment Factor
* Final Rate
* Fist Payment Due Date
* Balance Type _(i. Note Interest (interest only), ii. Note Due (Blended Payment), or iii. Note Balance (Fixed P&I)),_   {color:#ff991f}- Should be able to be chosen by system if Interest Only{color}
* Payment Type (i. Variable Calculated Interest (Int only), ii. Fixed Due Calc Int on Payment (Blended) or iii. Fixed Balance (Fixed Principle) {color:#ff991f}- Should be able to be chosen by system if Interest Only{color}
* Payment Amount
* Maturity Date



Account Roles

* Tax Reported For/Owner (populate primary borrower)
* Joint Member or Business Signors = Joint Member Name
** NonTax Signator and NonTax Owner (Personal only)   OR  
** NonTax Signator and  Authorized MDSB Signator
* Loan Officer (Who is the Lender)
* Authorizer (Who authorized)



+*Security*+

* Collateral Security Value
* Collateral Security Description



+*Closing Details*+

* Funding Date / Closing Date - populated when administrator clicks on Add Loan in Business Banker. (not manually entered)
* Total Disbursement amount
* Disbursement Amount _(What sending to member) - could be 1 to many adding to the total disbursement amount - suggest being able to add more than 1_
* Offsetting Deposit/DUCA Account
* Disbursement Method {color:#ff991f}(Wire or Bank Draft){color}
* Scheduled Review Date for MSLOC and IFA (default 1 year after disbursement for investment loan with ability for user to update)
* Authorizer - who is approver from Credit Risk (could be Michael, or Nishant or Jonathan - drop down with ability to add/remove others maybe maintained by Admin users?)
* PPSA registration #
* PPSA Expiry Date
* Payment Source / PAD
* AFT/PAD Set up (Yes/No)

Depending on if Wire or Bank Draft selected in Disbursement method, either the Wire section displays or the Bank Draft section.

column246:
12/Jan/24 1:55 PM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;# Anticipated Payoff Date should be from Business Banker - for IFA, should be 10 years
# Principal Disbursement amount is blank.    Should be same as credit limit which is different than the authorization amount.  For example, authorization amount could be $10,000,000 and with credit limit of $1,000,000.
# Collateral Description is blank - should be Life Insurer and the Life Insurance Policy Number
column247: 15/Feb/24 10:14 AM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;[~accountid:62b55f5ad337d0b7d09eb9e2] As discussed, for #2, leave the Principal Disbursement Amount field editable (but with edit that it cannot be more than the Credit Limit Amount).  For CAUT - Authorization Amount (Approved Total Credit Limit), for IFAs only, default to the Credit Limit Amount x 10, however leave the field editable (in some cases it is x 5 or x 7).   So if the Credit Limit Amount is $50,000, then the CAUT field should populate $500,000.
column248:
16/Feb/24 10:14 AM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;[~accountid:62b55f5ad337d0b7d09eb9e2] Hey Umair, just to be clear (I know I may not have been), here are the business rules to default the term (with keeping field open for editing).  Again, it is the term less a month from the first payment date (like you have for booking slip) - please update the credit facility section too to have same logic.   Once we get to booking slip stage, don’t need to go back to credit facility to update that. (That is the credit facility feeds info to Booking slip, but not the other way around)

Investment Loans and MSLOC (and other products)

* Interest Only - 30 years
* P&I - 20 years

IFA

* Interest Only - 10 years
* P&I - 20 years

NEED TO COMPLETE UI before we start - Chat with Andrea

Scenarios

* IFA Corporate
** Business Corporation (Business Client)
*** 1 to 4 owners 
*** Personal guarantor(s) or Corporate Guarantor
*** If corporate guarantors, can have 1 to 4 owners
* MSLOC Corporate 
** Business Corporation (Business Client)
*** 1 to 4 owners 
*** Personal guarantor(s) or Corporate Guarantor
*** If corporate guarantors, can have 1 to 4 owners
* MSLOC Personal with Corporate Guarantor
**  Personal Client
*** 1 to 2 borrowers
*** Corporate Guarantor
*** can have 1 to 4 owners

column1: TExtrak failed due to lack of compute power
column32:
Incident started Aug 18 8:20 ET - Resolved 8;35

Due to change in network and servers for Celero yesterday: Moved to a network specificaly built for Celero.  because of that It reverted to default settings for the compute power.  

There was lacking Textrack compute power today in tests in production. Textrac failed.   But worked after when we retested it. 

Zain decided to increase Compute power during test in production with Richard.

column32:
Currently it is in random? order.   Need to sequence the order as follows:

Borrower

Co-Borrower 

Advisor (as witness)

# Need the first popup sequence updated to First borrower and advisor when no coborrower
# Need first popup to have buttons Yes / Cancel
# Need the second popup sequence updated to First borrower, second borrower and advisor when coborrowers
# Need the second popup sequence updated to First borrower and advisor when no coborrower

column1: Collateral Security - redesign
column32:
The In Line and pop up is not working because there are too many fields.   

Can we consider adding all the required fields in the section and if a new collateral security is required, we can add a new tab in the section?   Similar to income taxes where if you have more than one T5, you go to the next tab.  

This way we are not limited to one row.

Let’s discuss.  This could be same treatment for Credit Facility section too

column1: Docusign - Subsequent documents sent should void the original ones
column26: Package 4 - October - Margin, QC Checks, Docusign
column32: If user sends documents out to sign via Docusign and then resends, only the latest documents should be valid.   The original ones should be void. column1: Cannot delete standard conditions
column32: As a Credit Risk user, I clicked on the garbage can to delete the standard condition, and it gets removed. However, when I transmit to SL, the deleted standard condition gets added back to SL and others.   This should not be a problem, however and have moved to low priority given these should be default conditions for all loans and therefore should not need to delete.

column1: Policy Type (Whole Life or Universal Life) in Credit Facility and Collateral Security..
column32:
Should only be in one spot - the Credit Facility.

The collateral security for Whole Life or Universal Life should copy from Credit Facility.   The documents are mapped to the field in Collateral security.   

If ‘Whole Life’ selected, then the Security = Life Insurance and Policy Type = Whole Life in Collateral Security section

If ‘Universal Life’ selected, then the Security = Life Insurance and Policy Type should be Universal Life in Collateral Security section 

If ‘Investments’ selected, then Security drop down should have: Segregated Funds, Mutual Funds/Managed Funds or GIC/Savings.
column245:
29/Feb/24 11:14 AM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;[~accountid:712020:9b49b6d5-769d-4632-9932-eab6a3e4f7da] There will not be a second credit facility for MSLOC.    It does not make business sense to have one collateral security and 2 loans tied to same collateral. 

So lets for the Collateral Security:

# default checkbox the collateral to link to the one credit facility (All products) and 
# default the whole life/universal life (for MSLOC only) and 
# disable the field the field in the Collateral security.   This can only be changed from Credit Facility for MSLOCs only



If ‘Whole Life’ selected in Credit Facility, then the Security = Life Insurance and Policy Type = Whole Life in Collateral Security section

If ‘Universal Life’ selected, then the Security = Life Insurance and Policy Type should be Universal Life in Collateral Security section

If ‘Investments’ selected, then Security drop down should have: Segregated Funds, Mutual Funds/Managed Funds or GIC/Savings.

See below:



For example, if Whole Life selected here,

!image-20240229-160329.png|width=469,height=326!

then it should “Life Insurance” as security

!image-20240229-160540.png|width=642,height=147!



and Whole Life defaulted (and field disabled)

!image-20240229-160640.png|width=634,height=319!



If Investments selected from Credit Facility, 

!image-20240229-160737.png|width=485,height=358!

then drop down should have:

# GICs or Savings
# Managed Accounts, Mutual Funds or ETFs
# Segregated Funds

Please remove Life Insurance and Investments.

!image-20240229-161008.png|width=642,height=296!
column246:
04/Mar/24 4:47 PM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;[~accountid:712020:261c0e4a-8bb5-4085-8acf-bde7f3f8ada3] Ok - looks good for MSLOC - when select Whole Life or Universal Life, it defaults to that and right fields appear in collateral security.    If select Investments, only Seg Funds, GICs and Mutual Funds appear.   The only thing is that the field is not disabled (user looks like they can change it, but each time, it goes back), but that is okay - they should not be changing it.   The other is that in line, if change from Whole Life or Universal in Credit Facility to Investments, the In Line stays as Insurance until user goes into the detailed screen to update.   Again this is okay and not needed to change.  But I wanted to make note of it.  

It also checks off the security box to tie it to the loan for MSLOC which is great.

SOC2 : resvolve vulnerabilities from Hostscan
column32:
This issue is related to [https://cognitivegroup.atlassian.net/browse/BUS-396|https://cognitivegroup.atlassian.net/browse/BUS-396|smart-link] 



We resolve these vulnerabilities in the new 3-4 months.  : 



1- SSL issue suggests that it is unable to check local issuer but it mentions certificate is from Sectigo and all of the browsers support the certificate. All the calls from client to server are protected by this certificate so I believe it is not urgent.

2- As for CSRF tokens, we haven’t implemented those as our login method doesn’t support http only coolies at the moment.

But we can get this in future.

3- As for frame-src: * we can address that after looking at our plugins like ck-editor which has a problem with these csp policies and they loose few features.
column245: 30/Aug/23 10:01 AM;5fe1ffaba9d030010747a650;1- SSL issue has been resolved. we are using AWS SSL now.

30/Aug/23 10:18 AM;70121:a2dd7e75-6319-4926-91a5-74785bb6ee3d;3- it is a vulnerability and we should address it.  

estimate 4 hours to solve.  will create a new Jira next week or week after that

[https://www.troyhunt.com/owasp-top-10-for-net-developers-part-5/|https://www.troyhunt.com/owasp-top-10-for-net-developers-part-5/|smart-link] 

2- OWASP

[https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/csrf|https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/csrf|smart-link]

[https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/security/anti-request-forgery?view=aspnetcore-7.0|https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/security/anti-request-forgery?view=aspnetcore-7.0|smart-link] 

*As for your previous comment*: “we haven’t implemented those as our login method doesn’t support http only coolies at the moment.”  JP1 checked for Cognito, and CSRF is present there, and we miss it for the application in general. SOC2: Hostscan Quarterly Report
column32:
[~accountid:5fe1ffaba9d030010747a650] 

-Remediate action items from JP1

-Add scan or explain why it cannot be done. 

-Answer to email : 

----

--Marie-Claude,

It was still on my list but not yet prioritized

!32.png|width=32,height=32,alt="🙂"!

You have reports for SSLyze (certificates), nmap (ports), and OWASP ZAP (web). You would need the OpenVAS scan which is the most complete scan on HostedScan.

* SSLyze

** unable to get local issuer certificate : this issue is weird... I see the certificate from Sectigo was imported to AWS Certificate Manager but it seems there is a misconfiguration. I would highly recommend issuing a certificate through AWS. It's free and never had that kind of issues before on a Cloudfront distribution.

!https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0?ui=2&ik=0484fe62a0&attid=0.1&permmsgid=msg-f:1768604029270416916&th=188b57fe80fcde14&view=fimg&fur=ip&sz=s0-l75-ft&attbid=ANGjdJ-nUA6eiPigAebCo_GHC6gmL5qyYQdldadZMwE7hHM6_rygzZua-neg_hHv1DM8YtJCv2qGe0xt81wkXRFuNW6VIYbBfPSY0LJJDOtV_SlFTTu-Cqubmcyaz-4&disp=emb|width=655,height=414!

* OWASP ZAP
** Absence of Anti-CSRF Tokens : This should be implemented and it's available in most popular frameworks.
** CSP: Wildcard Directive : Any reasons why to have "frame-src *"?
** CSP: script-src unsafe-eval : Any reasons why to have unsafe-eval? 
** CSP: style-src unsafe-inline : Not good either but still acceptable.
** Vulnerable JS Library :
*** AngularJS is [discontinued|https://blog.angular.io/discontinued-long-term-support-for-angularjs-cc066b82e65a]... 
*** There are a [few vulnerabilities|https://security.snyk.io/package/npm/angular/1.8.3] on this version.
*** [Angular|https://angular.io/] seems to be the evolution of AngularJS.
** Re-examine Cache-control Directives & Retrieved from Cache

*** Please be sure to review which endpoints are cached. No sensitive information should be cached.
column245:
23/Jun/23 2:59 PM;5fe1ffaba9d030010747a650;Hi [~accountid:70121:a2dd7e75-6319-4926-91a5-74785bb6ee3d] 

1- SSL issue suggests that it is unable to check local issuer but it mentions certificate is from Sectigo and all of the browsers support the certificate. All the calls from client to server are protected by this certificate so I believe it is not urgent.

23/Jun/23 3:09 PM;5fe1ffaba9d030010747a650;2- As for CSRF tokens, we haven’t implemented those as our login method doesn’t support http only coolies at the moment. 

But we can get this in future.
column247: 23/Jun/23 3:11 PM;5fe1ffaba9d030010747a650;3- As for frame-src: * we can address that after looking at our plugins like ck-editor which has a problem with these csp policies and they loose few features.

column1: SOC2: Upgrade packages for August Release
column32:
As a result of the ECR scan, those packages need to be updated in the August release

* glic
* zlib
* dpkg
* openssl
* libtasn1-6
* openldap
* curl
* cyrus-sasl2
* gnutls28. etc. 

See ECR scan report here: [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1xUgLbEgtoR5pakSKogl8lNyjOxlxCF4Blmqtvv7ibhQ/edit#gid=0|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1xUgLbEgtoR5pakSKogl8lNyjOxlxCF4Blmqtvv7ibhQ/edit#gid=0|smart-link]

column1: For Tor Alerts from Guarduty: Exclude server or create exception
column32:
Zain uses brave too, and we get this alert. 



Hi everyone!

I believe this server should be excluded from Guard Duty or should have a special exception for Tor.
For some reason, Brave browser does a check for Tor availability and that's where we get this issue.

Thanks,
Zain Ahmad Khan



On Sat, May 6, 2023 at 12:26 AM Marie-Claude Prévost <[mcprevost@cognitivegroup.com|mailto:mcprevost@cognitivegroup.com]> wrote:

{quote}Hi Zain, Jean-Philippe, Francois is telling me that he is not using Brave anymore.  We don't know why we still get that Tor Entry node alert.  Would you know? Marie-Claude 



On Fri, May 5, 2023 at 10:49 AM Jean-Philippe Lemelin <jplemelin@unicorne.cloud> wrote:Bonjour à vous,Simplement pour vous aviser qu'on à reçu des alertes de sécurité en lien avec l'instance de OpenVPNAjd,*"EC2 instance i-0a268fd607601c5c1 is performing an unusual DNS Over HTTPS (DoH) communication with server 8.8.8.8."*ça me semble un faux positif, 8.8.8.8 est un serveur de DNS de GooglePlus tôt cette semaine:"*EC2 instance i-0a268fd607601c5c1 is communicating with IP address 54.36.120.156 on the Tor Anonymizing Proxy network marked as an Entry node.*"ça me semble un faux positif, puisque c'est un VPN, bref il faudrait faire attention à ne pas utiliser TOR via le VPN.On a aussi reçu une alert de connection avec le ROOT user*"API ConsoleLogin was invoked using root credentials from IP address 173.179.193.141"*Il ne fait pas utiliser celui-ci, mais bien vos IAM UserVoilàJP{quote}

Credit Risk Status drop down in Decision and Comments Section(Deployed in Prod on July 27, 2023)
column32:
Credit Risk role - file status drop down:  

# *Approved,* 
# *Cancelled,* 
# *Declined,* 
# *Escalation / Recommended,* 
# *Escalation / Recommend Decline*

If 4. Recommended or 5. Recommended Decline, transmission goes to Nishant - Senior Manager of Credit Risk.  (Only individual in drop down list)

Nishant has the same items in drop down:

# *Approved,* 
# *Cancelled,* 
# *Declined,* 
# *Escalation / Recommended*
# *Escalation / Recommend Decline*

If 4. Escalation / Recommended or 5. Escalation / Recommended Decline, transmission goes to Jonathan - VP Credit Risk.  Jonathan would then have option to 

# Approve or 
# Decline and transmit back to Nishant - Senior Manager of Credit Risk.

Nishant would then make comment and transmit back to Lender

column1: Add Conditions Section for Credit Risk (Deployed in Prod on July 27, 2023)
column32:
This section is for Credit Risk to provide ‘conditional approval’.   

Suggest naming it ‘Conditions’ and make it available to update by Credit Risk and read-only for other roles.  These conditions should be hidden in Step 1 (Advisor) and step 2 (Lender)

The conditions should allow for free form and also a selection as follows by product:



Investment Loan – Standard Conditions

·         The Borrower(s) to open an DUCA account. $1.00 to be deposited to a share account prior to the advancing of funds

·         Confirmation of Control Security Agreement signed by Borrower, DUCA lender, and Investment company.

·         Confirmation that the DUCA Investment Loan Application signed, including Loan Disclosure Statement.



MSLOC – Standard Conditions

·         The Borrower(s) to open an DUCA bank account. $1.00 to be deposited to a share account prior to the advancing of funds.

·         Confirmation that the DUCA MS LOC Application signed, including Loan Disclosure Statement.



IFA – Standard Conditions

·         The Borrower(s) to open an DUCA account. $1.00 to be deposited to a share account prior to the advancing of funds.

·         Confirmation that the DUCA IFA Application, commitment letter signed, including Loan Disclosure Statement.

·         Confirmation of any outstanding policy loan must be immediately paid out and closed from the proceeds of the subject IFA.

·         Approval valid for 90 days.

column1: SOC2: Add "Emergency Change" to the Change Management process
column32:
We need to have a note in the Change Management Process for emergency Changes. According to Zain, it is slightly different. “ we deploy to all environments to save time.  Code review is always. Approval from DUca is always requested.”  

Requirement from Mark:

* Emergency change requests are documented and subject to the standard change management process but at an accelerated timeline. Prior to initiating an emergency change, appropriate approval is obtained and documented.

When we have a emergency change, we will need to have those evidences: 

'- Change documentation for one emergency change including: 

* - authorization for the change 
* - performance of testing, code review, QA 
* - approval for deployment into production 
* - name of individual whom performed each step above
column245: 18/Sep/23 9:30 AM;70121:a2dd7e75-6319-4926-91a5-74785bb6ee3d;completed on June 24, Changement management process updated

column1: SOC2 (WS3) include workstation in Patch Management process document
column32:
*FOr Soc2:* 

Controls WS3 says: A patch management process exists to confirm that operating system level vulnerabilities for workstations are remediated in a timely manner. In addition, workstations are scanned to test patch compliance on a quarterly basis.

*Provide required Evidence :* 

Patch Management Process that includes our workstations (example: -manual process, everybody sends a screenshot to show that they have the latest version of Microsoft) 

Mentionne somthing to the effect that people’s workstation are scanned to test patch compliance on a quaterly basis. 

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1o7UA5LmcBSP1ilEDWG_aykR_O0wfI50CjOgstQNIPyc/edit|https://docs.google.com/document/d/1o7UA5LmcBSP1ilEDWG_aykR_O0wfI50CjOgstQNIPyc/edit|smart-link] 

Read Acceptable use policy and see what applies or if there is anything that does match with  what you wrote in Patch management process. It is on the portal.
column245:
23/May/23 2:02 PM;70121:a2dd7e75-6319-4926-91a5-74785bb6ee3d;*Contente of Acceptable use policy to check :* 

*Use of personal or other third party equipment and services* 

* Cognitive Group Confidential Information must not be transferred to, or stored on, any personally owned or other third party equipment or service (whether copied,  transmitted or by other means) without the authorization of Cognitive Group’s CISO (Chief Information Security Officer). This includes mobile devices such as mobile phones, smart phones, and portable storage media. Where such approval is given, Cognitive Group continues to exercise control over any Cognitive Group Information stored on such devices and to protect such Cognitive Group information from loss or unauthorized access. 
* Cognitive Group Personnel may not attach any unauthorized devices to the Cognitive Group network, nor may they activate any unauthorized services; specifically, unauthorized wireless hot spots that connect directly to Cognitive Group network may not be created by Cognitive Group Personnel. Only Cognitive Group IT Assets may be connected to Cognitive Group’s networks. The connection of any non-Cognitive Group IT Asset requires the explicit approval of Cognitive Group’s CISO. Such equipment should meet, at a minimum, the following: 
** The latest vendor-supported version and up-to-date virus signature definitions of Anti-Virus (AV) software, received and applied; 
** The latest security patches for the operating system (e.g. Microsoft patches) and any software installed on non-standard workstations;
** Up-to-date anti-spyware protection; and 
** Encryption (that meets Cognitive Group’s standards and is explicitly approved by Cognitive Group’s CISO- Chief Information Security Officer). 
** Third party services (including third party services such as DropBox, One Drive, personal webmail, and other services such as Siri, and icloud), must not be used to handle or process Cognitive Group Information, without the express approval of Cognitive Group’s CISO (Chief Information Security Officer). 
* In order to avoid being infected by malware, Cognitive Group Personnel should exercise caution when receiving data from others through electronic means (for example don’t open an email from unknown sources or suspicious messages from known sources). 
* Cognitive Group supports a Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) program for mobile devices (tablets or smart phones). Cognitive Group Personnel must comply with all Cognitive Group policies and practices surrounding the registration and use of their mobile device for Cognitive Group purposes. All backup of Cognitive Group Information from the mobile device must only be onto Cognitive Group provided or approved storage. 
* Cognitive Group Personnel must not set up, activate or use any service or device intended to secretly record or transmit details of Cognitive Group or client confidential meetings or discussions, to any other person not directly involved in the meeting. Unauthorized surveillance of any individual is prohibited. Recordings made for the purpose of preparing minutes, or for replay at a later date to authorized individuals, are permitted by this policy, but the making of such recordings should be disclosed at the start of  the proceedings.

column1: SOC2 (SO2): configure auto scaling for every ECS service (Cancelled) .
column32:
NOTES FROM JP

-configure auto scaling for every ECS service.
-It is important not to forget the RDS database for auto scaling... Auto scaling for storage is enabled, but we need to consider whether to automatically add nodes or increase server capacity. This feature appears to be only available for AWS's Aurora service, but it is not available for MS SQL.

Technically, it is not a control absolutely required for SOC 2. It is likely easy to enable it for ECS services, and we could modify the control to indicate scaling the capacity and performance needs of web applications. 



CONTROLS FROM MARK 

-Infrastructure has been configured to automatically scale the capacity and performance needs of the systems

-Provide a screenshot of the configuration showing that infrastructure (such as production servers) are automatically scaled based on the capacity and performance needs of the systems.

column1: SOC2: (SO17) Produce a Scan report (HostScan.com) to identify threats and vulnerabilities to production
column32:
Produce the [HostScan.com|http://HostScan.com] report and send it to us.  

----

----

BACKGROUND INFO FOR REFERENCE ONLY. 

*For SOC2, we need to produce a Quarterly Vulnerability Scan Reports that covers control (SO17)* 

Vulnerability scan is performed on a quarterly basis to identify threats and vulnerabilities to the production systems. Issues identified are analyzed and remediated in a timely manner.

*After the report is produced we need to include short answers to the issues that have been identified.*  for example : 1: Issue name and description, Answer : Do nothing (reason why, i.e, do not apply because we don’t use python) 



*Use Hosted scan or  equivalent to produce that report.* 

* [https://hostedscan.com/|https://hostedscan.com/|smart-link] 
* [https://www.onsecurity.io/|https://www.onsecurity.io/|smart-link] 

Accordinf to Jean-Philippe : HostedScan, or the equivalent, is a scan of the application and infrastructure. The scan will be performed on a domain, for example, [https://|https://chat.openai.com/][businessbanker.com|http://businessbanker.com](or an IP address), in the production environment and will make several attempts with recognized attacks from the Internet. It is therefore an interesting tool to potentially simulate an external malicious person.

For control SO17, there is a mention of "to the production systems," so it is important to ensure that these scans are done in the production environment. HostedScan is a very simple solution to meet this control in 15 minutes for $0...

*How Hosted Scan differs from Veracode?* 

* Veracode = Dynamic Analysis Security Testing (DAST)

* SonarCloud = Static Application Security Testing (SAST)

A control is not specifically documented for these two scans, but it was a recommendation from iSecurity. These two scans are related to the best practices of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), and there is a control over the SDLC. SAST analyzes the source code, while DAST will run the application (Business Banker) in a controlled environment to make several attempts at known exploits, while also analyzing the source code. In both cases, it is to find vulnerabilities at the application level.

24/May/23 5:02 PM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;[~accountid:70121:6b338a5b-9f37-4a24-b8c4-d9e87056fce7] Here are some issues identified from testing.  See attached for the case imported and additional notes that correspond to these numbers.



# Under Identification Document, Issuing Province/territory defaults to ON, even though the application was Manitoba 
# Employer name not populating - positioning of the Employer name (top line?) (Works for Joint applicant)
# Occupation not picking up full occupation - picks up bottom line ‘Manager’ instead of General Manager
# Previous Occupation and Previous Earnings are in Business Banker, but not in the application - hide?
# *Co-Borrower* - Employment - Occupation not picking up full occupation - picks up bottom line ‘General’ instead of Assistant General 
# *Co-Borrower* - Identification Document Number - maps as 5555555 versus t5555555 (Populates letters in the Owner’s ID document number field)
# *Co-Borrower* - Under Identification Document, Issuing Province/territory defaults to ON, even though the application was Manitoba (Same with Joint Applicant/Co-Borrower)
# *Co-Borrower* - Previous Occupation and Previous Earnings are in Business Banker, but not in the application - hide?
# Other Information - Borrower -  Tax resident of US not populating in BB
# Other Information - Borrower -  Tax resident of other country - not populating in BB (Works for Co-borrower)
# Other Information - *Co-Borrower* -  Tax resident of US not populating in BB
# Once you click on Guarantor, there is no link to get back to the loan
# The label should not be ‘Member Information’ as guarantors are not members.   Should we change to Client Information throughout?

!image-20230524-203748.png|width=629,height=210!

14. Jurisdiction not populating - from app, should be Canada

15. Corporate Guarantor Owner - % Ownership does not populate in Owner Summary Page (Same for 2nd owner)

16. Corporate Guarantor Owner - Employer name not populating (Same for 2nd owner)

17. Corporate Guarantor Owner - extra fields in BB that can be hidden: (Same for 2nd owner)

i) Income (Annual)

ii) Annual Earnings (UPLOC)

iii) Previous Occupation

iv) Previous Annual Earnings

18. No-Coborrower is incorrect  - there is co-borrower

!image-20230524-205257.png|width=512,height=137!

19. In the Co-Borrower - should not have fields for Co-Borrower again

!image-20230524-205224.png|width=512,height=137!

20. Co-Borrower wishes to receive separate disclosure documents is not mapped correctly

!image-20230524-205231.png|width=512,height=137!

21. Maturity Date should default from 30 year term for MSLOC (not 1 year and the Maturity date is 4 months away?)

22. Amount label should be Limit for Line of Credit

23. Credit Facility fields should populate:

   Max Credit Limit - Yes/No (in this case should be Yes)

   Credit Limit Requested If No indicated (In this case, it was blank)

   Periodically Increase credit limit (Should be No)

24.  Security Section should populate insurance policy and company name

25. Additional Comments do not populate

column1: Missing attachments (Released to production on July 7, 2023)
column32:
In production, we have a user who transmitted an investment loan application.   We got the email notice.  However, when we went in, there were no attachments.   My understanding is that the applications need to be attached before transmit happens (System edit).     A few hours later, we went in and the applications and other documents were attached. I confirmed with the user and she said that she only submitted the applications and did not un-attach or reattach the documents   So not sure what happened.  It was both Janice and myself that went in and did not see the attachments and we saw another account and the attachments were there the same time this account was missing…

Client number 328 in production in Business Banker.

column267:
29/Jun/23 2:15 PM;70121:a2dd7e75-6319-4926-91a5-74785bb6ee3d;[~accountid:62741546106b60006f5964c5] here is our internal definition : 

!image-20230629-181536.png|width=224,height=88!



*Definitions*

*Minor :* 

* Bug fix, minor improvement (ex: change visual), patch (software update for minor issues)
* No impact on users - users do not need to be informed of change.

*Major:*  

* Major improvement (ex: change ergonomics, new feature, bug fix with major impact) 
* Impact on users - users need to be informed of change

column32:
Bonjour,

 

Je vous prie de trouver ci-dessous les conclusions issues de la séance de travail tenu ce jour entre François Aubin et moi sur le renforcement de le sécurité des mots de pass dans BB.

 

* *Concernant le planning :*

 

* Cognitive va terminer les travaux de programmation et de test le mercredi 18/04/2023 ;
* Une séance de travail sera organisée le jeudi 19/04/2023 pour la planification et la communication sur le déploiement qui normalement se fera le même jour ;
* La Direction Générale de CK devra communiquer sur les nouveautés apportées aux mots de pass le 19/04/2023 avant le déploiement ;

 

* *Renforcement du mot de pass* :

 

* Renouvellement obligatoire tous les 6 mois
* Exigences relatives au mot de passe :

 

* au moins 10 caractères
* au moins une lettre majuscule
* au moins une lettre minuscule
* au moins un chiffre
* au moins un caractère spécial (!"#$%&'()*+,-./:;>=<?@[\]^_`{|}~ )

 

Par ailleurs, le déploiement de la nouvelle version de BB est prévu pour le début du mois de mai. Entre temps, un planning d’exécution sera mis en place d’un commun accord.

column1: Apostrophe (') in client name fields (First, Last), address fields etc. do not get mapped into PDF(Deployed in Prod on July 27, 2023)
column32:
[~accountid:70121:6b338a5b-9f37-4a24-b8c4-d9e87056fce7] [~accountid:70121:a2dd7e75-6319-4926-91a5-74785bb6ee3d] I tested and if there are apostrophe in address and client name fields, the field shows blank on the PDF - Investment Loan application, Membership application, SCA.   I tested other characters including -, #, @, &,., and they appear to work.   

This is considered a medium- high severity production bug as it is common to have names with apostrophes.



Let’s discuss if this is something that makes sense to have a release soon

!image-20230417-192626.png|width=658,height=112!

column1: Need to change Margin Breach report rule
column26: Package 4 - October - Margin, QC Checks, Docusign
column32:
Currently, it is 100% for a 3:1 investment loan to show as Margin Breach.

In future, if it breaches 100%, the subsequent weeks need to go below 99% before it is removed from the breach report.

column248:
17/Apr/23 3:23 PM;5fe1ffaba9d030010747a650;I have changed the Margining module completely to support this request. We have introduced multiple reports in backend system which allow us to generate new reports based on past records.

Impacts

* Margin Calculations
* Ancillary
* SPL
* Breach Calculation based on previous loan



Note: This change requires to revisit the previous reports so It can generate internal data, otherwise it won’t calculate the past history which i used in newer reports.

column253:
10/Apr/23 1:53 PM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;[~accountid:70121:6b338a5b-9f37-4a24-b8c4-d9e87056fce7] 

A. The definitions need to be exact 

Remove ' or a prescribed family member' in all info tips as they are not part of definitions

B. Suggest subheadings to not confuse.



For first infotip, should read:

*Politically Exposed Domestic Person*
A person who, at a given time, holds—or has held within a
prescribed period before that time—one of the offices or
positions referred to in any of paragraphs (a) and (c) to (j) in or on
behalf of the federal government or a provincial government or
any of the offices or positions referred to in paragraphs (b) and (k):
(a) Governor General, lieutenant governor or head of
government;
(b) member of the Senate or House of Commons or member of
a legislature of a province;
(c) deputy minister or equivalent rank;
(d) ambassador, or attaché or counsellor of an ambassador;
(e) military officer with a rank of general or above;
(f) president of a corporation that is wholly owned directly by
Her Majesty in right of Canada or a province;
(g) head of a government agency;
(h) judge of an appellate court in a province, the Federal Court of
Appeal or the Supreme Court of Canada;
(i) leader or president of a political party represented in a
legislature;
(j) holder of any prescribed office or position; or
(k) mayor, reeve or other similar chief officer of a municipal or
local government.

*Family Members and Close Associates*

A prescribed family member of a politically exposed foreign
person, a politically exposed domestic person or a head of an
international organization is:
(a) their spouse or common-law partner;
(b) their child;
(c) their mother or father;
(d) the mother or father of their spouse or common-law partner;
or
(e) a child of their mother or father.
A close associate may be an individual who is closely connected
to a PEP or HIO for personal or business reasons. For example:
• Business partners
• Romantic relationships
• Prominent members of the same political party or union
• Members of the same Board
• Carrying out charitable works together

For second infotip, should read:

*Politically Exposed Foreign Person*
A person who holds or has held one of the following offices or
positions in or on behalf of a foreign state:
(a) head of state or head of government;
(b) member of the executive council of government or member
of a legislature;
(c) deputy minister or equivalent rank;
(d) ambassador, or attaché or counsellor of an ambassador;
(e) military officer with a rank of general or above;
(f) president of a state-owned company or a state-owned bank;
(g) head of a government agency;

(h) judge of a supreme court, constitutional court or other court
of last resort;
(i) leader or president of a political party represented in a
legislature; or
(j) holder of any prescribed office or position.

*Family Members and Close Associates*

A prescribed family member of a politically exposed foreign
person, a politically exposed domestic person or a head of an
international organization is:
(a) their spouse or common-law partner;
(b) their child;
(c) their mother or father;
(d) the mother or father of their spouse or common-law partner;
or
(e) a child of their mother or father.
A close associate may be an individual who is closely connected
to a PEP or HIO for personal or business reasons. For example:

* Business partners
* Romantic relationships
* Prominent members of the same political party or union
* Members of the same Board
* Carrying out charitable works together

Third info tip should read:

*Head of an International Organization*
A person who, at a given time, holds—or has held within a
prescribed period before that time—the office or position of
head of:
(a) an international organization that is established by the
governments of states;
(b) an institution of an organization referred to in paragraph (a); or
(c) an international sports organization.


*Family Members and Close Associates*
A prescribed family member of a politically exposed foreign
person, a politically exposed domestic person or a head of an
international organization is:
(a) their spouse or common-law partner;
(b) their child;
(c) their mother or father;
(d) the mother or father of their spouse or common-law partner;
or
(e) a child of their mother or father.
A close associate may be an individual who is closely connected
to a PEP or HIO for personal or business reasons. For example:
• Business partners
• Romantic relationships
• Prominent members of the same political party or union
• Members of the same Board
• Carrying out charitable works together

column1: SOC2: Use manual process to approve release to production
column32:
It needs to be approved by an *authorized person* which is *different than the requester.*

*Use that template:* 
Change Request to be send to [security@cognitivegroup.com|mailto:security@cognitivegroup.com] with the following information:

||*Scope*|What are the systems and services impacted by this change?|
||*User*|What is the user used to perform this change? For example, on AWS, it would be the AWS SSO user.|
||*Jira Issue ID*|What is the related Jira issue ID?|
||*Impact*|* +Minor+: A minor change is a modification of an existing service e.g. update a value within an existing configuration.
* +Major+: A major change is the deployment of a new service e.g. a new value within an existing configuration, new service deployed, new third-party service implemented, etc.|
||*Back-out Process*|What are the required steps to return to the previous functional state?|
||*Test Plan*|If a major change, the change must be previously deployed in the staging environment. Otherwise, it is not required but recommended.|
||*Communication Plan*|Communication is only required when a change could have downtime for more than 10 minutes.|
||*Deployment Date*|What is the deployment date or the deployment window to implement this change?|

column1: Add MSLOC as loan type to drop down for Create Facilities and some extra fields.(Deployed in Prod on July 27, 2023)
column32:
Currently, we have 

3:1 Investment Loan

3:1 Investment Loan and Unsecured Personal Line of Credit

3:1 Investment Loan and Bridge Loan

3:1 Investment Loan and Unsecured Personal Line of Credit and Bridge Loan

*Please add*

Margin Secured Line of Credit to drop down



{color:#bf2600}*We can discuss the below, but wanted to give some of my thoughts.*{color}

The new information for this credit facility includes:

*Type of Line of Credit Requested:*

Suggest following implementation to map what is on paper:

# Is this MSLOC Insurance secured or Investment Secured?
## If Insurance secured, provide following options:
### Option to capitalize interest or pay interest only  _(even if select the option to capitalize interest, applicant can decide to pay interest still)_
#### If choose option to capitalize interest, provide options
##### Do you want Limited Underwriting for a lower LTV OR Full Underwriting for higher LTV
##### Payment Type - Capitalize Interest or Interest Only
#### If Interest Only, no further option - Payment Type is Interest Only
## If Investment secured, then no further option - Payment Type is Interest Only



*Credit Limit Requested (**_replace Loan amount perhaps?)_*

Ask questions:

# Initial credit limit:   [ ] ‘maximum value possible’

                                      [ ] other amount $_________

  2. Do you give DUCA the authorization to periodically increase my credit limit?  Yes/No



*Collateral Security*

Show only what is selected from Type of Line of Credit selected above

If Insurance secured, need following fields:

Insurance Policy #, Company Name, CSV Value, Date Issued, Irrevocable Beneficiary - Yes/No, Owner’s Name, Joint Owner’s Name, Life Insured Name, Joint Life Insured Name



If Investment secured, need following details: (radio buttons represented by o)

o Mutual Fund Account, Dealership name

o Segregated Fund Contract, Company name

o GIC or Deposit Account, Company name

Plus following fields:

Market Value, Date Issued, Irrevocable Beneficiary - Yes/No (Seg fund contract), Owner’s Name, Joint Owner’s Name, Life Insured Name (Seg fund contract), Joint Life Insured Name (Seg fund contract)

column1: Add DSCR (Debt Service Coverage Ratio
column32:
Add DSCR for Lender and Credit Risk



DSCR = Adjusted Operating Income / Total Debt Service

Adjusted Operating Income = EBITDA (Earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization) - Extraordinary or Non-Recurring Items - Dividends

Total Debt is the aggregate of all annual principal, interest and capital lease obligations associated with debts, including the current credit facility)

column1: SOC2: Help Marie-Claude complete:  '- Change documentation for one change
column32:
*We need to pick a change and document:* 

'- Change documentation for one change including: 

- authorization for the change 

- performance of testing, code review, QA 

- approval for deployment into production 

- name of individual whom performed each step above

 *JP1 Said :* I suppose that you have unit tests executed by Jenkins? Be sure that we can retrieve these reports for each Github pull request. 

Same for SonarCloud SAST reports. 

* Do you have a checklist for manual tests? If so, all changes, or only specific kind or changes? 

* Be sure that we are able to trace one Github pull request, the required tests, and the approval. 

It's then required to trace that pull request on Octopus with the right approvals.

*Zain Said & other notes:* 

ZainL all the document in Jira, based on that, we are sending thos changes to production, ZAIN: no unit test done. column1: Security:Implement Logical Access Control to comply with ISecurity
column32:
Cognitive Group should have all its laptop and/or desktop devices joined to central directory services. This will ensure that a standard set of security controls are applied towards passwords for domain authentication. Various solutions are available for MAC OS or Windows for centralized password and security Policy Management.  This will also ensure that controls on those endpoints are consistent across the board and policies such as device controls, Group Policies, Hardening and remote management can be executed. 



We do understand that Developers require flexibility, and some of the staff simply uses G-Suite for email/collaboration, however, if an endpoint is not managed then it can be subject to many types of breaches. 



Currently these assets have a standard image. Controls need to be applied with a Golden Image on these assets. 



Users can surf the internet and given there is no malicious web-site control, risk is even higher.

column1: SIN number goes blank when member profile is edited
column32:
Hi, [~accountid:70121:6b338a5b-9f37-4a24-b8c4-d9e87056fce7] 

Last name: Wilby

3 to 1 +BRIDGE + UPLOC

When we edit a member info SIN Number goes blank. The SIN was entered previously.

Screenshot attached
column245: 18/Jan/23 12:40 PM;70121:6b338a5b-9f37-4a24-b8c4-d9e87056fce7;[~accountid:5caba8cc3270b449b4fef328] that's an intended feature, once you enter a SIN, you can not see it as a user in view you you don’t see the last three digits, and in edit it goes blank then if you save you see the 6 first digits again
column246:
19/Jan/23 12:23 PM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;[~accountid:70121:6b338a5b-9f37-4a24-b8c4-d9e87056fce7] [~accountid:5caba8cc3270b449b4fef328] 

I connected with Andrea and saw the requirement which I pasted below.

Yes, there is a requirement that the masked digits will not be viewable even while editing SIN, however the masked digits are only the last 3 digits.

So yes, in edit, please present what is available on review - i.e. first 6 digits unmasked and then last 3 digits masked.   



+*SIN/TIN*+

After a SIN/TIN is entered in a front-end system (e.g., ASAPP, DOXIM, Scarlett) and moves to the core banking system (DNA), the {color:#bf2600}*last three digits*{color} of the number will be masked for those roles that do not require access, as per the DNA Roles and Responsibility Matrix that is currently being developed.

SIN/TIN will be masked in all DNA screens including the Search, Quick Search, Edit Person, and Tax ID screens, as well as the Banner Bar. SIN/TIN will be masked for all person types, including non-member person types (e.g., POA, parent /guardian, signing authorities). {color:#bf2600}The masked digits will not be viewable even while editing the SIN/TIN.{color}

column1: Create new loan from existing client not working properly
column32:
When advisor selects existing client and selects ‘New Loan Request’, I anticipate the following:



* Member information is the defaulted to be the same (although the user can edit)
* Credit Facility only captures the new loan - remove the previous (current loan) / blank out
* Collateral Security removed / blanked out
* Rest of the fields can defaulted but editable (assets, liabilities, income, Other obligations, Additional Details
* Remove any attachments from previous loan
* The numbering is off - Client information is now 11



Success Test Criteria

# When add new loan from client,
## The Old / previous Credit Facility is not shown (deleted from new loan)
## The  old / previous Collateral security is not shown for new loan
## Remove any attachments from previous loan
## The new attachments are based on new credit facility and collateral security

17/Jul/23 5:08 PM;70121:6b338a5b-9f37-4a24-b8c4-d9e87056fce7;[~accountid:62741546106b60006f5964c5] We have two potential paths we could take. *Option 1* is to allow deletion, while *Option 2* is to remove the deletion function and rely on pulling for assets.

*Option 1* is more standard with the widget, implying that users have the freedom to delete. On the other hand, *Option 2* aligns more with tasks where the lender adjusts the assets but does not delete them - they could potentially set the value to zero in the worst-case scenario.

If the user haven’t modified a value in adjusted asset or liability then deletion didn’t impact it and it continues to clone previous section completely.

column1: UPLOC, Bridge and Investment Loans - separate in popup
column26: Package 3 - July - UPLOC, Bridge, Corp Inv Loan; Welcome Packages
column32:
Today, advisor can choose to have 3:1 investment loan, UPLOC and Bridge together which is great.   It is easier to capture information.  However, once they submit to Lender, the 3 products need to be separate requests, each with own application ID and loan number so that one product can be approved and another declined.

For these products entered by Lender, the lender will need to enter one at a time, however, they can leverage the select member and select loan function (I believe that exists) and just change the loan type and submit each individually.

So let’s break up the list.

If advisor selects personal, they should have the following products in drop down with 3:1 investment loan showing first.

3:1 Investment Loan

UPLOC

Bridge Loan

If advisor selects corporate, they should have the following products in drop down with 3:1 investment loan showing first:

1:3 Investment Loan

Bridge Loan

column1: Audit Trail - Field edits
column32:
We need to keep track of field edits and who made the edits.

For example if Advisor inputs Asset and Liabilities or Member information, and Lender changes, we need history / audit trail of that.

Another example is if Credit Risk changes something in the Adjusted Liabilities, we need it tracked (date and time stamped along with user)

column1: Notifications of status changes

column1: Credit Risk - Process of Assigning (Deployed in Prod on July 27, 2023)
column32:
Today, the process which we want to replicate is as follows:

Email sent to a generic mailbox - [SpecializedLendingDeals@duca.com|mailto:SpecializedLendingDeals@duca.com]

An individual on team would then sign into the Loan Origination System (i.e. Business Banker) and locate that deal and underwrite it.   Then notes etc. would be tied back to that individual.

So to make this work, I think the Lender would ‘transmit’ to Specialized Lending generic mailbox and an email would be sent to that team.  However the members of that group, would then be able to log into Business Banker, locate those deals and work on it.

Can we leverage the Branch/Dealer functionality for this?
column245: 13/Oct/22 3:29 PM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;should be ready soon… I understand
column246:
22/Oct/22 1:19 AM;70121:3046a3be-0247-4ecd-a0c7-ed926ad50a0a;I think we already support that.

We can create a user ‘Specialized Lending’, and we have an option to send it to a role instead of a user, and we can associate a default user to a role (ex: SL).

Anyone with the right role can modify the loan.

So, Was is that you were thinking about ?
column247: 22/Oct/22 1:30 AM;70121:3046a3be-0247-4ecd-a0c7-ed926ad50a0a;Is this for every step that need to be sent to a SL ?
column248:
22/Oct/22 1:06 PM;62741546106b60006f5964c5;[~accountid:70121:6b338a5b-9f37-4a24-b8c4-d9e87056fce7] [~accountid:70121:3046a3be-0247-4ecd-a0c7-ed926ad50a0a] 

Hi Francois Girard,

So when Francois Aubin and I looked at it, we changed the circuit so that it sends to role instead of user - (You are correct).  However, once user assigns to the role (e.g. CR), an email needs to be sent to the team so they are aware that there is a new file.    That is the missing piece - we are not sure how to configure an email to the role.  In this case, it would be for Credit Risk role, an email to [SpecializedLendingDeals@duca.com|mailto:SpecializedLendingDeals@duca.com]

The workaround I was thinking was setting up another generic user, but then everyone in the CR role can be chosen.   We can tell our team to only pick the generic user - this we can assign the email like any other user and would work too, however, don’t really want user to pick who to transmit to (But if we can’t do the first option, then we go with this).

We will also need the same function for Admin as well and potentially for Lender too in future.



Hope this clarifies - we can discuss further Monday

column1: Equifax - Link to client
column32: Right now, I believe Equifax report is tied to loan.   However, if same client wants a new loan within x period (3 months), we don’t need to pull another credit bureau.  So lender needs to know that they don’t need to pull another credit bureau.   Can the Equifax report be tied to Client and Loan?

column1: Lender - Should be able to save attached files
column32: Lender’s normal process is that they save the files into a Shared drive and then review them.  Instead of having to open each file up and then saving, is there a way to bulk save to a user specified folder?  Similar to Outlook attachments where  you can bulk save all attachments in an email?
